commit_message:
Removes logic dependent on 'odl_on_controller'

Since moving to composable service/roles there was some logic here that
was relying on a variable to enable ODL rather than enabling the service
itself to decide where ODL was enabled.  Now that ODL and ODL OVS
configuration are split into 2 different services we can make these
truly composable.

Partial-Bug: 1633625

Change-Id: Ia55c05e12d5d434111a13e1ed795da530e3ff4a5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/32/387532/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $opendaylight_controller_ip = $odl_api_ips[0] $odl_url_ip = hiera('opendaylight_api_vip')
deleted_lines: # Figure out ODL IP (and VIP if on controller) if hiera('odl_on_controller') { $opendaylight_controller_ip = $odl_api_ips[0] $odl_url_ip = hiera('opendaylight_api_vip') } else { $opendaylight_controller_ip = hiera('opendaylight::odl_bind_ip') $odl_url_ip = $opendaylight_controller_ip }

commit_message:
Mds Relation

Small changes needed to make the mds relation function
properly. The mds_relation now uses the remote unit
name that to generate the cephx key. lib/ceph was also
synced to the latest.  Ceph_broker create cephfs
is now idempotent.

Change-Id: I8eb022030d833af6d1daa9b61265bde68f3e79b2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/47/383947/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_cephfs(service): """ List the Ceph Filesystems that exist :rtype : list. Returns a list of the ceph filesystems :param service: The service name to run the ceph command under """ if get_version() < 0.86: # This command wasn't introduced until 0.86 ceph return [] try: output = subprocess.check_output(["ceph", '--id', service, "fs", "ls"]) if not output: return [] """ Example subprocess output: 'name: ip-172-31-23-165, metadata pool: ip-172-31-23-165_metadata, data pools: [ip-172-31-23-165_data ]\n' output: filesystems: ['ip-172-31-23-165'] """ filesystems = [] for line in output.splitlines(): parts = line.split(',') for part in parts: if "name" in part: filesystems.append(part.split(' ')[1]) except subprocess.CalledProcessError: return []

commit_message:
Release OpenStack-Ansible Liberty/12.2.6

To remind reviewers, The Liberty and Mitaka releases
for OpenStack-Ansible are both tagged 'independent'
and not cycle releases. The same file must therefore
be changed to facilitate the release.

This patch is on top of the Mitaka release patch and
will therefore fail the CI verification of tags until
the Mitaka release patch has merged.

Change-Id: I4ae80ef3a9fa82ae2bf78c0fe469af682e58afcb

commit_message:
Revert "Add retries to upstart/systemd reload"

This reverts commit 0986fa15d4d4226e02f4e38bec4296edf8b88843.

This did not help at all and it actually ends up slowing down
the deployment. The real problem was resolved in subsequent
patches so I think it's better to remove this.

Change-Id: Ie1b492ea38a17dcaefd309f9e56feeda80ca96ee
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_cinder refs/changes/16/386616/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Added ensure parameter to pass to service identity

Pass ensure to service identity so resources can be created
or removed based on class ensure parameter.

Change-Id: Id34672a07e1b8669ae73008f48509d9fe4463c70
Depends-On: I51b75baa84058779ca2c00f3ac2657c42831e51d

commit_message:
Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Iae9e5c6e5a5f68cb7f0a0dfc0edb0d21912cda19

commit_message:
prepare newton final releases for cycle-trailing projects

Add final release tags for all of the deliverables following the
cycle-trailing release model and using pre-release versions.

Change-Id: Id79dca980b13ff48ad34432beb7daf2d677995d3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make Murano always use the latest CoreLibrary

When we updating environment Murano doesn't update
CoreLibrary if it's already installed. So we need
to make it always install latest CoreLibrary version.

Change-Id: I361ac156f4059f0a100ae192654403cd328c90c3
Closes-Bug: #1624723

commit_message:
Make Murano always use the latest CoreLibrary

When we updating environment Murano doesn't update
CoreLibrary if it's already installed. So we need
to make it always install latest CoreLibrary version.

Change-Id: I361ac156f4059f0a100ae192654403cd328c90c3
Closes-Bug: #1624723

commit_message:
Add _member_ role to Swift operator list

Newly created users unable to interract with Swift by default,
to fix this, we need to add _member_ role to Swift operator list.

Change-Id: Ia4a2ab35efa0e4304b9aba39d59c643848aa123e
Closes-Bug: #1561241
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/85/318085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $swift_operator_roles = pick($swift_hash['swift_operator_roles'], ['admin', 'SwiftOperator', '_member_'])

commit_message:
Switch horizon to use versionless keystone endpoint

According to horizon patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/321640/,
horizon now supports versionless keystone endpoint, so we need
to use versionless endpoint by default to be consistent with
other components.

Change-Id: I30c4382188f1c10d2a862b7db89b2bc9666d9c2d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/73/327573/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $keystone_url = "${internal_auth_protocol}://${internal_auth_address}:${internal_auth_port}"

commit_message:
Downcase all hostnames for MySQL user/db creation

Mysql puppet providers apply downcase method for hostnames, that
lead us to errors when we use hostnames with upper-case letters.

Change-Id: If94ed4d5cc6c0fb9a0db27dcc1c7ea45ccfb963a
Closes-Bug: #1537325
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/83/334783/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with uppercase host' do let (:title) { 'nova_HOST1' } let :params do { :user => 'foobar', :password_hash => 'AA1420F182E88B9E5F874F6FBE7459291E8F4601', :database => 'nova', :privileges => 'ALL' } end it { is_expected.to contain_mysql_user("#{params[:user]}@10.0.0.1").with( :password_hash => params[:password_hash] )} it { is_expected.to contain_mysql_grant("#{params[:user]}@host1/#{params[:database]}.*").with( :user => "#{params[:user]}@host1", :privileges => 'ALL', :table => "#{params[:database]}.*" )} end

commit_message:
Make nova-consoleauth use memcache as cache backend

Now Mirantis OpenStack uses python dictionary's to store
nova-consoleauth tokens and it fails to connect to VNC on
page reload if we use HA cluster, so we need to use
memcache as cache backend.

Change-Id: I7da25b331f5665ec1b82544f476aebefdfa6113d
Closes-Bug: #1576218
(cherry picked from commit fc333aab261e6d255dbf818d2d48ec332f20feb3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/72/357672/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if pick($nova_hash['use_cache'], true) { class { '::nova::cache': enabled => true, backend => 'oslo_cache.memcache_pool', memcache_servers => $memcached_addresses, } } else { ensure_packages($pymemcache_package_name) } Package[$pymemcache_package_name] -> Nova::Generic_service <| title == 'api' |>
deleted_lines: # From legacy init.pp if !defined(Package[$pymemcache_package_name]) { package { $pymemcache_package_name: ensure => present, } -> Nova::Generic_service <| title == 'api' |> }

commit_message:
Fix template for multiple physical networks

This patch [1] adds support to config multiple physical networks for
ovs neutron plugin, but it missed to change ml2_conf.ini.j2
correspondingly.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/373455/

Change-Id: I1937e1e5986657470add07d4bcf8587642aa45ec
Closes-bug: #1631903
(cherry picked from commit 1706e17ae921ec436410b9824433c1805506a1a1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/71/389671/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: hardware: Standarized flavor/image meta extraction
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-17 14:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/48e0c000fefe561ec5cfa1364ef2cac2f6ce9244', 'message': 'hardware: Standarized flavor/image meta extraction

Extracting a configuration option from both flavor extra specs and
image metadata is rather common operation. Standardize how we do it.

Change-Id: Ic993d79e155805160fc7dcad269f6423a145c272
'}]
commit_message:
hardware: Standarized flavor/image meta extraction

Extracting a configuration option from both flavor extra specs and
image metadata is rather common operation. Standardize how we do it.

Change-Id: Ic993d79e155805160fc7dcad269f6423a145c272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/06/387506/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_flavor_image_meta(key, flavor, image_meta): """Extract both flavor- and image-based variants of metadata.""" flavor_key = ':'.join(['hw', key]) image_key = '_'.join(['hw', key]) flavor_policy = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get(flavor_key) image_policy = image_meta.properties.get(image_key) return flavor_policy, image_policy flavor_request, image_request = _get_flavor_image_meta( 'mem_page_size', flavor, image_meta) flavor_mask, image_mask = _get_flavor_image_meta( 'cpu_realtime_mask', flavor, image) # Image masks are used ahead of flavor masks as they will have more # specific requirements flavor_policy, image_policy = _get_flavor_image_meta( 'cpu_policy', flavor, image_meta) flavor_thread_policy, image_thread_policy = _get_flavor_image_meta( 'cpu_thread_policy', flavor, image_meta) flavor_nodes, image_nodes = _get_flavor_image_meta( 'numa_nodes', flavor, image_meta) if flavor_nodes and image_nodes: raise exception.ImageNUMATopologyForbidden( name='hw_numa_nodes') nodes = None if flavor_nodes: _validate_numa_nodes(flavor_nodes) nodes = int(flavor_nodes) else: _validate_numa_nodes(image_nodes) nodes = image_nodes
deleted_lines: flavor_request = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get("hw:mem_page_size", "") image_request = image_meta.properties.get("hw_mem_page_size", "") flavor_mask = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get("hw:cpu_realtime_mask") image_mask = image.properties.get("hw_cpu_realtime_mask") flavor_policy = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get('hw:cpu_policy') image_policy = image_meta.properties.get('hw_cpu_policy') flavor_thread_policy = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get( 'hw:cpu_thread_policy') image_thread_policy = image_meta.properties.get('hw_cpu_thread_policy') nodes = flavor.get('extra_specs', {}).get("hw:numa_nodes") props = image_meta.properties if nodes is not None: _validate_numa_nodes(nodes) if props.obj_attr_is_set("hw_numa_nodes"): raise exception.ImageNUMATopologyForbidden( name='hw_numa_nodes') nodes = int(nodes) else: nodes = props.get("hw_numa_nodes") _validate_numa_nodes(nodes)

commit_message:
Generate internal TLS hieradata for apache services

This adds an environment file that can be used to enable TLS in
the internal endpoints via certmonger if used. This will include
a nested stack that will create the hash that will be used to
create the certmonger certificates.

When setting up a service over apache via puppet, we used to disable
explicitly ssl (which sets modd_ssl-related fields for that vhost).
We now make this depend on the EnableInternalTLS flag. This has only
been done for keystone, but more services will be added as the
puppet code lands

bp tls-via-certmonger

Depends-On: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039
Change-Id: I12e794f2d4076be9505dabfe456c1ca6cfbd359c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/75/366075/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EnableInternalTLS: type: boolean default: false ceilometer::wsgi::apache::ssl: {get_param: EnableInternalTLS}

subject: Enable TLS in the internal network for keystone
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-08 11:33:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/2714eb002ec2b45ee1f88450e6a049ebc8e0c253', 'message': 'WIP: Enable TLS in the internal network for keystone

This enables TLS for keystone in the internal network. If internal
TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone service will
use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted). This command should be different for the base and the
pacemaker profiles.

Change-Id: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039

If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted). This command should be different for the base and the
pacemaker profiles.

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039

commit_message:
Enable TLS in the internal network for keystone

This optionally enables TLS for keystone in the internal network.
If internal TLS is enabled, each node that is serving the keystone
service will use certmonger to request its certificate.

This, in turn should also configure a command that should be ran when
the certificate is refreshed (which requires the service to be
restarted).

bp tls-via-certmonger
Change-Id: I303f6cf47859284785c0cdc65284a7eb89a4e039
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/29/327029/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. # # == Class: tripleo::internal_tls # # Optionally sets some default defaults necessary for the internal TLS setup. # # === Parameters # # [*enable_internal_tls*] # (Optional) Whether to configure TLS for the internal services or not. # Defaults to false # # [*global_ca*] # (Optional) The certmonger nickname for the CA that will be used. # This value is mandatory if internal TLS is enabled. # Defaults to undef # class tripleo::internal_tls ( $enable_internal_tls = false, $global_ca = undef, ){ if $enable_internal_tls { include ::certmonger unless $global_ca { fail("If internal TLS is enabled, you must provide the 'global_ca' parameter.") } Certmonger_certificate { ca => $global_ca, ensure => 'present', certbackend => 'FILE', keybackend => 'FILE', require => Class['::certmonger'], } } }

commit_message:
Add the workflow name to the starting workflow message

It turns out that "Started Mistral Workflow. Execution ID:
58b6090b-7afb-4259-979c-f7a42b6de144" is not a particularly useful
message.

Include the Workflow name in the message to give the user more context.
Then it would be something like "Starting Mistral Workflow
tripleo.baremetal.register_or_update. Execution ID: ..." which explains
itself far more.

This change also adds the message to two baremetal workflow calls that
previously didn't include it.

Change-Id: I63e97ae88681dbf5aa29cb43f6d944061df6b7e0

subject: Fix order of arguments in assertIs

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-09 07:34:28.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/test_utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/e6a5bdabb61be1d03ea291d4d4fe640f4e93ec43', 'message': "Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected the expected value.
  observed the observed value.
  message optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I8bd1bf8e93fe4babc25a955dcfbeca2c38f5c9a6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected the expected value.
  observed the observed value.
  message optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I8bd1bf8e93fe4babc25a955dcfbeca2c38f5c9a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/87/367787/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Pre-add instance actions to avoid merge conflicts

NotificationAction enum values for instance actions are added in a
single commit to avoid merge conflicts when it is added one by one
during the notification transformation.

Also the notification samples added as comments for the same reason.

Change-Id: Idfe41af8718bf5e81ea1608f4c6d00d7cf60cd13
Implements: bp versioned-notification-transformation-ocata

commit_message:
Tune enum fields for validation

The Enum from oslo.versionobjects is not supporting 'enum' validation
properly, especially when the value can be None (null in JSON term).
This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: Ie0f64333614351078839a9da915df8cf1afc37c7

commit_message:
Remove support for non-keystone auth systems

The support for non-keystone auth systems and plugins
was deprecated with 1f11840dd84f3570330d1fcd53d1e8eea5ff7922
back in the 3.1.0 release in mitaka.

Now that we're working on shoring up the support for
keystone auth sessions in the client and eventually moving
to remove support for the non-session HTTPClient, we should
also remove the support to load non-keystone auth plugins.

The whole concept of non-keystone auth systems/plugins is
a legacy artifact and is a barrier to interoperability which
is a goal of nova and OpenStack in general.

Change-Id: Ia649db257c416ca054977812ecb3f1a8044fa584

' Auth plugins should now be done as plugins to keystoneauth' ' and selected with --os-auth-type or OS_AUTH_TYPE')) auth_plugin = novaclient.auth_plugin.load_plugin(os_auth_system) else: auth_plugin = None # Do not use Keystone session for cases with no session support. commit_message:
conf: deprecate ``periodic_enable``

Option ``periodic_enable`` is deprecated, as setting it to
False causes Nova to fail.

Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

Change-Id: Ic2ee552e48dd597845adb118f8bf39acefe31674

subject: Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 21:29:49.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-libvirt.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1c4ade1d66450a49da9cb17528d21d47e000bf80', 'message': 'Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration

Port 16509 should be opened for tcp traffic to enable live migration.

See Also:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-configuring-migrations.html

Previously, we were not enabling any iptables rules on the Compute
Roles, so this is a regression.

Change-Id: Ie4abf53dc2a8171af48d02e34a1a3ad43f27cfb3
Closes-Bug: #1635427
'}]
commit_message:
Open port 16509 for libvirt for live migration

Port 16509 should be opened for tcp traffic to enable live migration.

See Also:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/compute-configuring-migrations.html

Previously, we were not enabling any iptables rules on the Compute
Roles, so this is a regression.

Change-Id: Ie4abf53dc2a8171af48d02e34a1a3ad43f27cfb3
Closes-Bug: #1635427
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/58/389358/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Move bandit to pep8 as generic linting target

bandit is a security linter and can be made voting now. Instead of
starting another virtual machine, run it as part of the generic linting
target which is pep8.

Change-Id: I6a8f7aa2b60bd96d55b37b6cc2a371069d6d5e6a

commit_message:
UUID, started_at, finished_at in the status API

Enhance the introspection status with the fields:

* uuid
* started_at
* finished_at

Change-Id: I36caa7d954a9bfb029d3f849fdf5e73f06f3da74
Partial-Bug: #1525238

added_lines: from ironic_inspector import api_toolsclass GetStatusAPIBaseTest(BaseAPITest): def setUp(self): super(GetStatusAPIBaseTest, self).setUp() self.uuid2 = uuidutils.generate_uuid() self.finished_node = node_cache.NodeInfo(uuid=self.uuid, started_at=42.0, finished_at=100.1, error='boom') self.finished_node.links = [ {u'href': u'http://localhost/v1/introspection/%s' % self.finished_node.uuid, u'rel': u'self'}, ] self.finished_node.status = { 'finished': True, 'started_at': api_tools.iso_timestamp( self.finished_node.started_at), 'finished_at': api_tools.iso_timestamp( self.finished_node.finished_at), 'error': self.finished_node.error, 'uuid': self.finished_node.uuid, 'links': self.finished_node.links } self.unfinished_node = node_cache.NodeInfo(uuid=self.uuid2, started_at=42.0) self.unfinished_node.links = [ {u'href': u'http://localhost/v1/introspection/%s' % self.unfinished_node.uuid, u'rel': u'self'} ] self.unfinished_node.status = { 'finished': False, 'started_at': api_tools.iso_timestamp( self.unfinished_node.started_at), 'finished_at': api_tools.iso_timestamp( self.unfinished_node.finished_at), 'error': None, 'uuid': self.unfinished_node.uuid, 'links': self.unfinished_node.links} @mock.patch.object(node_cache, 'get_node', autospec=True) class TestApiGetStatus(GetStatusAPIBaseTest): def test_get_introspection_in_progress(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = self.unfinished_node self.assertEqual(self.unfinished_node.status, def test_get_introspection_finished(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = self.finished_node self.assertEqual(self.finished_node.status,
deleted_lines: class TestApiGetStatus(BaseAPITest): @mock.patch.object(node_cache, 'get_node', autospec=True) def test_get_introspection_in_progress(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = node_cache.NodeInfo(uuid=self.uuid, started_at=42.0) self.assertEqual({'finished': False, 'error': None}, @mock.patch.object(node_cache, 'get_node', autospec=True) def test_get_introspection_finished(self, get_mock): get_mock.return_value = node_cache.NodeInfo(uuid=self.uuid, started_at=42.0, finished_at=100.1, error='boom') self.assertEqual({'finished': True, 'error': 'boom'},

commit_message:
Shotgun retirement spec

Implements blueprint: shotgun-retirement

Change-Id: I4c440acc80d4032eb3f00c765b0494b2b523202a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/98/341598/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ========================================== Get rid of the shotgun ========================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/shotgun -------------------- Problem description -------------------- * It is not possible to create a diagnostic snapshot when WebUI, Nailgun or Astute is broken. * There is a code duplication. There are at least two utilities doing the same thing: Shotgun and Timmy. In fact there are more, for instance Ansible is capable of doing the same thing. * There is a problem with segregation of concerns. Shotgun is a part of the Fuel, however it gathers not only Fuel logs. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- The solution is to replace shotgun with Timmy. Web UI ====== The button "Generate diagnostic snapshot is deleted". Instead there is a paragraph of the text describing ways of gathering necessary information with Timmy for MOS and also instructions of its obtaining and installation for community version. Nailgun ======= Get rid of the code which handles snapshot creation. Data model ---------- No changes. REST API -------- Get rid of snapshot creation API. Orchestration ============= Get rid of Astute snapshot creation logic. RPC Protocol ------------ Get rid of dump_environment message. Fuel Client =========== No changes. Plugins ======= No changes. Fuel Library ============ No changes. ------------ Alternatives ------------ There are tools capable of performing the same task, for instance, Ansible. However, integrating them would require a lot more effort. -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- No impact. --------------- Security impact --------------- No impact. -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- No impact. --------------- End user impact --------------- It slightly worsens user experience, but in exchange there is more flexibility. ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ Timmy is expected to be faster than Shotgun. ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- MOS ISO is expected to include Timmy package by default. ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- No impact. --------------------- Infrastructure impact --------------------- CI must be changed to adopt Timmy in order to be able to gather diagnostic snapshots. -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- Documentation must be supplemented with a chapter devoted to Timmy installation and usage and alternative tools to perform the diagnostic snapshot gathering. -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Primary assignee: gkibardin Other contributors: None Mandatory design review: vkozhukalov Work Items ========== * Ensure Timmy default configuration produces snapshot with enough information. * Add Timmy package to the master node. * Get rid of existing snapshotting UI. * Switch QA snapshotting code to Timmy. * Get rid of snapshotting code in Nailgun and Astute. * Implement filtering by date range in Timmy. * Reflect a switch to Timmy in the fuel documentation. Dependencies ============ No dependencies. ------------ Testing, QA ------------ Testing involves ensuring that default Timmy configuration produces a snapshot with not less information than a snapshot produced by Shotgun. Acceptance criteria =================== Timmy CLI works. CI produces snapshot artifacts as a part of testing process. ---------- References ---------- N/A

Merge values correctly

update message.

commit_message:
Enable propagate_task_deploy in Web UI

So that it could be set by a user.
Also error message is returned in a structured way so that UI could
display it.
Also partial update of cluster attributes is supported.

Change-Id: Ib4a434039213cc91e0514240e722b7266f158ec5
Closes-Bug: #1621429
(cherry picked from commit d00f3d9228496bf25354dd4d6b6bdeaceecc2ad1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/29/376629/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cluster.attributes.editable, 'common', 'propagate_task_deploy', 'value') new_value = not get_in( if new_value is not None: legacy_tasks_are_ignored = new_value 'propagate_task_deploy attribute is set. ' 'Ensure tasks.yaml is empty and all tasks ' 'has version >= 2.0.0.')

subject: Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-01-11 02:32:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7699ade9ac0fa7530f02024cbeab72d461e4edac', 'message': 'Clean up l3 agent side HA router stuffs

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router
RPC l3 agent could clean up all resoutces of a HA router.

And partially soloving the Race Exception,
HA router has no ha interface:
Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deleting(after a
router delete API call), neutron server side
_process_sync_ha_data may get a HA router without
ha interface information, this is the mainly reasion why
HA router info has no HA port, then l3 agent may not be
able to init its keepalived_manager. Finally the router
will not be able to remove from the l3 agent router_info.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1523780

"}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-02-16 02:52:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eb8a9ea6ce1435052245b339814efc2ca59510cc', 'message': "Clean up l3 agent side HA router stuffs

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC
l3 agent could clean up all resources of a HA router.
And partially solving the Race Exception:
'HA router has no HA interface'

Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deletion(after a
router delete API call), neutron server side
_process_sync_ha_data may return HA router data without
HA interface information, this is the mainly reasion why
l3 agent get a HA router info without HA interface, then
l3 agent may not be able to init HA router keepalived_manager.
Finally the l3 agent will not be able to process the deleting
RPC because of the None value of the HA router keepalived_manager,
and the router will not be able to remove from the l3
agent router_info cache.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1533441
Related-Bug: #1523780
"}, {'number': 7, 'created': '2016-02-26 02:04:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a4d56f95824165b4b97c4363ed8fe6490d2cb716', 'message': "Clean up l3 agent side HA router stuffs

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC
l3 agent could clean up all resources of a HA router.
And partially solving the Race Exception:
'HA router has no HA interface'

Once race happened between l3 agent rpc get router info
call(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deletion(after a
router delete API call), neutron server side
_process_sync_ha_data may return HA router data without
HA interface information, this is the mainly reasion why
l3 agent get a HA router info without HA interface, then
l3 agent may not be able to init HA router keepalived_manager.
Finally the l3 agent will not be able to process the deleting
RPC because of the None value of the HA router keepalived_manager,
and the router will not be able to remove from the l3
agent router_info cache.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1533441
Related-Bug: #1523780
"}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2016-07-08 08:02:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/29922904b73e5ec52f113e70bb4115d937bfe20b', 'message': "Clean up L3 agent side HA router stuffs

Once race happened between l3 agent RPC get router info call
(plugin_rpc.get_routers) and HA port deletion(after a router
delete API), neutron server _process_sync_ha_data may return
HA router data without HA interface information, this is the
mainly reason why l3 agent could get a HA router info without
HA interface, then l3 agent will not be able to initiate the
keepalived_manager.

Finally the l3 agent will not be able to process the deleting
RPC because of the None value of the keepalived_manager, and
the router will not be able to remove from the l3 agent router
info cache.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC l3 agent
could clean up all resources of a HA router.
And partially solving the Race Exception: 'Unable to process HA
router x without HA port'.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1533441
Related-Bug: #1523780

"}, {'number': 19, 'created': '2016-09-05 09:14:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/3784d5b39a467b12ec23a612919f671e9f2d7580', 'message': "Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1607381
"}, {'number': 20, 'created': '2016-09-05 14:54:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/eff838334620c59ed5368cf8a65a59dbc978f290', 'message': "Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1607381
"}, {'number': 21, 'created': '2016-09-07 06:51:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9bd1c3935bf29a65a1e4f39ac313da0a2e7b2252', 'message': "Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router. Let this become
the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Closes-Bug: #1607381
"}, {'number': 22, 'created': '2016-09-07 07:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6474577b74394535767eeaee9eb8b9f7207b0f8f', 'message': "Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent

the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Related-Bug: #1607381
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve infinite loops in L3 HA agent side

Once a HA router went to ACTIVE state, it will be scheduled
to L3 agents. And then L3 agents will try to sync the router
info. This may be racy with the router deleting API, aka neutron
server function `_process_sync_ha_data` may return HA router
data without HA interface information because the concurrent
deletion.

And finally the L3 agent will get a HA router without the HA
interfaces (ports). You may see the info, 'Unable to process
HA router x-id without HA port', in l3 agent.log.
Then a series of effects happened in l3 agent:
  1. HA router will not be able to initiate the keepalived_manager.
  2. HA router will not be able to process the deleting RPC because
  of the absence of ha_port and keepalived_manager.
  3. Failed to delete HA router caused infinite loop.

This patch is to ensure that after a delete router RPC L3 agent
could clean up the resources of a HA router. Let this become
the last guard in L3 agent side.

Change-Id: I3b33af236d816e1ef93d6d81804fab82092671ca
Related-Bug: #1607381

commit_message:
modify description of "Inject guest networking config"

The description of "Inject guest networking config" in
support-matrix is misleading. Correct it.
In fact, If we config static ip,
guest os can not access metadata service to get ip config.
Closes-Bug: #1612913

Change-Id: I1892e5273a77516dd8e1525e6064fb95fa65e4d3

commit_message:
[vncproxy] log for closing web is misleading

When user close console web, log will record "Target closed vmsg".
In fact, Target is not closed, webclient is closed

commit_message:
Use %autosetup instead of %setup

This simplifies the process of adding patches to spec files.
Adding a patch is then just adding a %patch source and %Autosetup
will apply the patches in order.

Also add a speccheck for that case.

Change-Id: Ic4a925d800f3816b6cea865f779aa455e5b5a592

commit_message:
Disable Swift auditors and replicators on the undercloud

Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore
recovering from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running
replicators and auditors only wastes resources.

Closes-Bug: 1632885
Change-Id: Ic93082282e9ea481c13832f8ce1265a47f0ef3d5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/instack-undercloud refs/changes/46/385846/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Swift is using only a single replica on the undercloud. Therefore recovering # from a corrupted or lost object is not possible, and running replicators and # auditors only wastes resources. include ::swift::params $needless_services = [ $::swift::params::account_auditor_service_name, $::swift::params::container_auditor_service_name, $::swift::params::object_auditor_service_name, $::swift::params::account_replicator_service_name, $::swift::params::container_replicator_service_name, $::swift::params::object_replicator_service_name] service { $needless_services: ensure => stopped, enable => false }

subject: Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:01:02.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/run-tox-with-oslo-master.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/dc53443d844b25b5d6ac57c7ad2616fac1286839', 'message': "Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code

Currently periodic jobs for oslo are failing since
tox was thinking the oslo-from-master.sh from master
script was dying. It wasn't actually, this should
fix that by making sure the diff command doesn't return
non-zero (we expect a difference).

Also show the post-alteration tox.ini, so that its

Change-Id: I6a73bab746f22e5ae749dc798a189c9f255cddda
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure a diff does not cause a non-zero return code

Currently periodic jobs for oslo are failing since
tox was thinking the oslo-from-master.sh from master
script was dying. It wasn't actually, this should
fix that by making sure the diff command doesn't return
non-zero (we expect a difference).

Also show the post-alteration tox.ini, so that its
easier to see if a change to it is invalid (especially
when there are some further issue).

Change-Id: I6a73bab746f22e5ae749dc798a189c9f255cddda
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/01/389301/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Diff seems to exit with non-zero on a difference, but since # we expect there to be a difference, we don't want to have this # (or tox) fail due to that... diff -u pip_freeze_before.txt pip_freeze_after.txt || trueecho "Post-modification tox.ini:" cat tox.ini

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 0.11.0 in test-requirements

Hacking's latest release is 0.11.0. Most other ironic projects are using
this release.

These updates are done project-by-project to avoid introducing
unexpected new hacking rules to projects. This version bump already
applies cleanly to python-ironic-inspector-client with no code style

commit_message:
Add angurlar toggle feature for receivers panel

Now you can enable receiver panel via settings
(_11_toggle_angular_features.py.example) in horizon.

Change-Id: Iba81eae2820cbbacbc7ae094c2484910a0e6a1cf
See: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_11_toggle_angular_features.py.example

commit_message:
Add -test package for python-novaclient

Package consumers may want to run the unit- or functional tests.
For that some extra Requires and files are needed. Add theses
to the new -test subpackage.

Depends-On: Ie983f7a80cc540dc9a60b0321bbb1c7940169cd4
Change-Id: Ief889a93e2dbc7a8c020906fd3f9a983a67407e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rpm-packaging refs/changes/00/389000/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: %package test Summary: Testsuite for OpenStack Nova API Client Group: Development/Languages/Python Requires: %{name} = %{epoch}:%{version} Requires: {{ py2pkg('fixtures') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('python-glanceclient') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('python-keystoneclient') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('mock') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('os-client-config') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('requests-mock') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('testrepository') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('testscenarios') }} Requires: {{ py2pkg('testtools') }} %description test This is a client for the OpenStack Nova API. There's a Python API (the novaclient module), and a command-line script (nova). Each implements 100% of the OpenStack Nova API. This package contains the testsuite. # handle the test subpackage %openstack_test_package_install novaclient %files test %license LICENSE %openstack_test_package_dir

commit_message:
Wait longer for installer to be ready

After starting the VM for building the basedisk, we currently wait for
5 seconds for the installer to be ready before we start sending our
prepared keyboard input.

This patch increases the waiting time to 10 seconds.

Rationale: 5 seconds is just about enough. On a fairly typical laptop,
it becomes a race, on a slower laptop, chances are the installer won't
be ready by the time we start giving it commands. If we don't wait long
enough, the installation will fail. Ideally, we would have a different
method of detecting that the installer is ready. For now, we just have to
try and err on the side of caution.

backport: From master.
Change-Id: I6dfb96d758c1facbc0b4db570b80c36132fa561e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-labs refs/changes/83/387383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Note: It takes about 5 seconds for the installer in the VM to be ready # on a fairly typical laptop. If we don't wait long enough, the # installation will fail. Ideally, we would have a different method # of making sure the installer is ready. For now, we just have to # try and err on the side of caution. local delay=10

commit_message:
Move unit tests to a separate folder

Until recently, os-win did not have any functional tests. As we're
now starting to add such tests, we need to clearly separate unit
tests.

Note that most OpenStack projects have already done this separation.

This change moves the unit tests to a separate folder.

Change-Id: I1649fae7095f9b4024e526358ac70a58189365bf

commit_message:

commit_message:
Set memcached_servers for nova API

This patch updates the Nova profile so that we set memcached
servers correctly for the Nova keystone auth_token middleware.

Most of the hiera settings for ::nova::keystone::authtoken are
already included in the t-h-t nova-api service.

Change-Id: I3b7ff02abbd0d5e0c38232d02b33e4c7bc411120
Closes-bug: #1633595
(cherry picked from commit 2e234e2e3510e405de2ff97754b96681bf49bcff)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/76/389176/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hiera('nova::use_ipv6', false) { $memcache_servers = suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri(hiera('memcached_node_ips_v6'))), ':11211') } else { $memcache_servers = suffix(any2array(normalize_ip_for_uri(hiera('memcached_node_ips'))), ':11211') } class { '::nova::keystone::authtoken': memcached_servers => $memcache_servers }

commit_message:
Reduce the tenants stack create timeout

Observing the logs this now take between 2 and 3 minutes. Reduce the
timout appropriatly so that we hit it early instead of waiting for 20
minutes(and possible hitting the global timout).

Related-Bug: #1578708
Change-Id: I692cf241ab08f7319b091b5a336e84ba8384f0d5

commit_message:
Disables Neutron ML2 config on Compute for OpenDaylight

This is not needed with ODL and actually triggers deployments to fail
due to missing ODL username/password info on compute nodes.

Depends-On: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2

Closes-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ib88e8ef91c393d30c44b86a932103f5a294bc547
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6b9fe61995d3cece93fa152b2ef9120690b957b2)

commit_message:
Fixes missing ODL ML2 Authentication info

Without this, neutron-server fails to start and communication will not
work to ODL REST.

Parital-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a970cf81d8b06c6999966b20ad2b4c980b3b107b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/28/389328/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*odl_username*] # (Optional) Username to configure for OpenDaylight # Defaults to 'admin' # # [*odl_password*] # (Optional) Password to configure for OpenDaylight # Defaults to 'admin' # $odl_port = hiera('opendaylight::odl_rest_port'), $odl_username = hiera('opendaylight::username'), $odl_password = hiera('opendaylight::password'), $conn_proto = hiera('opendaylight::nb_connection_protocol'), $step = hiera('step'), odl_username => $odl_username, odl_password => $odl_password, odl_url => "${conn_proto}://${odl_url_ip}:${odl_port}/controller/nb/v2/neutron";

commit_message:
Document Calico semantics and floating IP support

Change-Id: Ib66f555aa7380fb1390f00b5235979516afdd34f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/89/388789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. _floating-ips: Floating IPs ============ networking-calico includes beta support for floating IPs. Currently this requires running Calico as a Neutron core plugin (i.e. :code:`core_plugin = calico`) instead of as an ML2 mechanism driver. .. note:: We would like it to work as an ML2 mechanism driver too - patches and/or advice welcome! To set up a floating IP, you need the same pattern of Neutron data model objects as you do for Neutron in general, which means: - a tenant network, with an instance attached to it, that will be the target of the floating IP - a Neutron router, with the tenant network connected to it - a provider network with :code:`router:external True`, with a subnet with a CIDR that floating IPs will be allocated from, and that is set as the router's gateway (e.g. with :code:`neutron router-gateway-set`) - a floating IP, allocated from the provider network subnet, that maps onto the instance attached to the tenant network. Then the Calico agents will arrange that the floating IP is routed to the instance's compute host, and then DNAT'd to the instance's fixed IP address.

commit_message:
Show tenant_id in *-list by admin

If API call is done by admin, neutron API returns all resources
from all tenants. We received several times a request that
tenant_id is useful in such case.

This patch displays tenant_id column when *-list is invoked
by a user with 'admin' role by default. If columns to be displayed
are specified by '-c' option, the specified columns are honored
and tenant_id columns is not added.

Add functional tests to cover this change. This feature depends
on keystoneauth1 and unit tests cannot cover this change.

Closes-Bug: #1526238
Change-Id: Id58a0b795f76b4fe24aaf89f1f6486c23f19a553

commit_message:
Stricter validation for cluster-create

This patch enables the ClusteCreateRequestBody to use the CapacityField
for stricter value validation. It also ensures that the 'timeout' field
specified is not a negative integer.

Change-Id: I928959c68f879d3f4cb7a025aeafd3120890c783
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/87/389487/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_opt('max_nodes_per_cluster', 'senlin.common.config') def test_request_body_to_primitive(self): def test_request_to_primitive(self): def test_init_body_err_min_size_too_low(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['min_size'] = -1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("The value for the min_size field must be greater " "than or equal to 0.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_min_size_too_high(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['min_size'] = CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster + 1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("The value for the min_size field must be less than " "or equal to %s." % CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster, six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_max_size_too_low(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['max_size'] = -2 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("The value for the max_size field must be greater " "than or equal to -1.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_max_size_too_high(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['max_size'] = CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster + 1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("The value for the max_size field must be less than " "or equal to %s." % CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster, six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_desired_too_low(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['desired_capacity'] = -1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("The value for the desired_capacity field must be " "greater than or equal to 0.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_desired_too_high(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['desired_capacity'] = CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster + 1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual(("The value for the desired_capacity field must be " "less than or equal to %s." % CONF.max_nodes_per_cluster), six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_body_err_timeout_negative(self): body = copy.deepcopy(self.body) body['timeout'] = -1 ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterCreateRequestBody, **body) self.assertEqual("Value must be >= 0 for field 'timeout'.", six.text_type(ex))

None) mock_check.assert_called_once_with(x_cluster, 8, None, None, True) mock_action.assert_called_once_with( self.ctx, '12345678ABCDEFGH', consts.CLUSTER_RESIZE, name='cluster_resize_12345678', cause=am.CAUSE_RPC, status=am.Action.READY, inputs={ consts.ADJUSTMENT_TYPE: consts.CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE, consts.ADJUSTMENT_NUMBER: 15.81, consts.ADJUSTMENT_MIN_SIZE: None, consts.ADJUSTMENT_MAX_SIZE: None, consts.ADJUSTMENT_MIN_STEP: None, consts.ADJUSTMENT_STRICT: True }, ) notify.assert_called_once_with() def test_cluster_resize2_type_missing_number(self): req = orco.ClusterResizeRequest( identity='CLUSTER', adjustment_type=consts.EXACT_CAPACITY ) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_resize2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: Missing number value for " "size adjustment.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) def test_cluster_resize2_number_without_type(self): req = orco.ClusterResizeRequest( identity='CLUSTER', number=10 ) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_resize2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: Missing adjustment_type " "value for size adjustment.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) def test_cluster_resize2_bad_number_for_exact_capacity(self): req = orco.ClusterResizeRequest( identity='CLUSTER', adjustment_type=consts.EXACT_CAPACITY, number=-5 ) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_resize2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: The 'number' must be " "positive integer for adjustment type " "'EXACT_CAPACITY'.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_cluster_resize2_cluster_not_found(self, mock_find): req = orco.ClusterResizeRequest( identity='CLUSTER', adjustment_type=consts.EXACT_CAPACITY, number=10 ) mock_find.side_effect = exc.ResourceNotFound(type='cluster', id='CLUSTER') ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_resize2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') self.assertEqual(exc.ResourceNotFound, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The cluster (CLUSTER) could not be found.", six.text_type(ex.exc_info[1])) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') @mock.patch.object(su, 'check_size_params') @mock.patch.object(no.Node, 'count_by_cluster') @mock.patch.object(service.EngineService, 'cluster_find') def test_cluster_resize2_failing_size_check(self, mock_find, mock_count, mock_check): x_cluster = mock.Mock(id='CID') mock_find.return_value = x_cluster mock_count.return_value = 5 mock_check.return_value = 'size check.' req = orco.ClusterResizeRequest( identity='CLUSTER', adjustment_type=consts.EXACT_CAPACITY, number=5 ) ex = self.assertRaises(rpc.ExpectedException, self.eng.cluster_resize2, self.ctx, req.obj_to_primitive()) mock_find.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CLUSTER') mock_count.assert_called_once_with(self.ctx, 'CID') mock_check.assert_called_once_with(x_cluster, 5, None, None, True) self.assertEqual(exc.BadRequest, ex.exc_info[0]) self.assertEqual("The request is malformed: size check.", commit_message:
Request object for cluster-resize

This adds a versioned object for cluster-resize requests.

Change-Id: I79a39b43a3749b8f139846ca2d330efb9c8f94e9

added_lines: class TestClusterResize(test_base.SenlinTestCase): def test_init(self): sot = clusters.ClusterResizeRequest(identity='foo') self.assertEqual('foo', sot.identity) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('adjustment_type')) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('number')) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('min_size')) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('max_size')) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('min_step')) self.assertFalse(sot.obj_attr_is_set('strict')) def test_init_with_params(self): sot = clusters.ClusterResizeRequest(identity='foo', adjustment_type='EXACT_CAPACITY', number=100, min_size=10, max_size=100, min_step=1, strict=False) self.assertEqual('foo', sot.identity) self.assertEqual('EXACT_CAPACITY', sot.adjustment_type) self.assertEqual(100, sot.number) self.assertEqual(10, sot.min_size) self.assertEqual(100, sot.max_size) self.assertEqual(1, sot.min_step) self.assertFalse(sot.strict) def test_init_failed_type(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', adjustment_type='BOGUS') self.assertEqual("Field value BOGUS is invalid", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_failed_number(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', number='foo') self.assertEqual("could not convert string to float: foo", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_failed_min_size(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', min_size=-1) self.assertEqual("The value for the min_size field must be greater " "than or equal to 0.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_failed_max_size(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', max_size=-2) self.assertEqual("The value for the max_size field must be greater " "than or equal to -1.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_failed_min_step(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', min_step=-3) self.assertEqual("Value must be >= 0 for field 'min_step'.", six.text_type(ex)) def test_init_failed_strict(self): ex = self.assertRaises(ValueError, clusters.ClusterResizeRequest, identity='foo', strict='fake') self.assertIn("Unrecognized value 'fake'", six.text_type(ex))

commit_message:
Add 'Boolean' and 'AdjustmentType' fields

The oslo version of 'Boolean' field (type) is virtually not usuable.
We propose our own reason for validation's purpose. The AdjustmentType
field type is a lot easier to understand.

Change-Id: I4a140c290124899bc36cd0628cc3944a7f9bc345
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/85/389085/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestBoolean(TestField): def setUp(self): super(TestBoolean, self).setUp() self.field = senlin_fields.BooleanField() self.coerce_good_values = [ ('True', True), ('T', True), ('t', True), ('1', True), ('yes', True), ('on', True), ('False', False), ('F', False), ('f', False), ('0', False), ('no', False), ('off', False) ] self.coerce_bad_values = ['BOGUS'] self.to_primitive_values = [ (True, True), (False, False) ] self.from_primitive_values = [ ('True', 'True'), ('False', 'False') ] def test_stringify(self): self.assertEqual('True', self.field.stringify(True)) self.assertEqual('False', self.field.stringify(False)) class TestAdjustmentType(TestField): def setUp(self): super(TestAdjustmentType, self).setUp() self.field = senlin_fields.AdjustmentTypeField() self.coerce_good_values = [ ('EXACT_CAPACITY', 'EXACT_CAPACITY'), ('CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY', 'CHANGE_IN_CAPACITY'), ('CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE', 'CHANGE_IN_PERCENTAGE') ] self.coerce_bad_values = ['BOGUS'] self.to_primitive_values = self.coerce_good_values[0:1] self.from_primitive_values = self.coerce_good_values[0:1] def test_stringify(self): self.assertEqual("'EXACT_CAPACITY'", self.field.stringify('EXACT_CAPACITY')) def test_stingify_invalid(self): self.assertRaises(ValueError, self.field.stringify, 'BOGUS')

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants in tests

There are several places in the source code where
HTTP response codes are used as numeric values.

These values are used from six.moves and the
numeric values are replaced by constants.

All of the used status codes were replaced with symbolic constants
from six.moves.http_client.
More about six.moves.http_client can be found at [2],
under the table "Supported renames:".

Also, this change improves code readibility.

This patchset does not extract numeric values from
the code itself, but it can be found at [1].

[1]: Ib9e26dcea927e96e65c626c18421621d3a29a64d
[2]: https://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves

Change-Id: Idfc7b043552f428f01ac3e47b270ee0639a8f5bc
Closes-Bug: #1520159

This patchset does not extract numeric values

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the source code where
HTTP response codes are used as numeric values.
These values are used from six.moves and the
numeric values are replaced by constants.

All of the used status codes were replaced with symbolic constants
from six.moves.http_client. More about six.moves.http_client can be
found at [2], under the table "Supported renames:".

Also, this change  improves code readibility.

This patchset does not extract numeric values
from the tests, but it can be found at [1].

[1]: Idfc7b043552f428f01ac3e47b270ee0639a8f5bc
[2]: https://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves

Change-Id: Ib9e26dcea927e96e65c626c18421621d3a29a64d
Partial-Bug: #1520159

commit_message:
Update the wording of date format on overview panel

Using different letter cases in the date format is unnecessary and
confusing.

Closes-bug: #1634187
Change-Id: Ifa34c19d9eb2573af95b8ae73bd0f8e632dc270c
(cherry picked from commit 45ca5b25d8af0132e4e1136956c4534047c99b09)

commit_message:
correct options for mysql_install_db

  * Using the correct options for mysql_install_db so that it continues to work
    with MySQL 5.7.x.
  * Build-Depends on default-mysql-client and default-mysql-server instead of
    mysql-client & mysql-server (the later is kept as an alternative).

Change-Id: I5532ad5d7afef7062a9cbb96ec3c03612b89485f

added_lines: MYSQL_VERSION=/usr/sbin/mysqld --version 2>/dev/null | grep Ver | awk '{print $3}' | cut -d- -f1 MYSQL_VERSION_MAJ=$(echo $MYSQL_VERSION) | cut -d. -f1 MYSQL_VERSION=/usr/sbin/mysqld --version 2>/dev/null | grep Ver | awk '{print $3}' | cut -d- -f1 MYSQL_VERSION_MID=$(echo $MYSQL_VERSION) | cut -d. -f2 MYSQL_VERSION=/usr/sbin/mysqld --version 2>/dev/null | grep Ver | awk '{print $3}' | cut -d- -f1 MYSQL_VERSION_MIN=$(echo $MYSQL_VERSION) | cut -d. -f3 if [ "${MYSQL_VERSION_MAJ}" -le 5 ] && [ "${MYSQL_VERSION_MID}" -lt 7 ] ; then MYSQL_INSTALL_DB_OPT="--force --skip-name-resolve" else MYSQL_INSTALL_DB_OPT="--basedir=/usr" fi mysql_install_db --no-defaults --datadir=${MYTEMP_DIR} ${MYSQL_INSTALL_DB_OPT} --user=${ME}

commit_message:
Handle unhandled ValueError Exception

Currently ValueError exception was not handled in utils.py,
This patch handles that exception as well as adds unit test
for the two methods.

Change-Id: Icdb31b4ff535b2e4cf801fadae2f70c91403f31a

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import wsme from zun.api.utils import validate_limit from zun.api.utils import validate_sort_dir from zun.tests import base class TestUtils(base.BaseTestCase): """Test cases for zun.api.utils""" def test_validate_limit(self): self.assertEqual(1000, validate_limit(None)) self.assertEqual(1000, validate_limit(1001)) self.assertEqual(50, validate_limit(50)) with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Limit must be positive"): validate_limit(-1) with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Limit must be positive"): validate_limit(0) with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Limit must be positive integer"): validate_limit('a') with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Limit must be positive integer"): validate_limit('5.5') def test_validate_sort_dir(self): self.assertEqual('asc', validate_sort_dir('asc')) self.assertEqual('desc', validate_sort_dir('desc')) with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Invalid sort direction"): validate_sort_dir(None) with self.assertRaisesRegexp(wsme.exc.ClientSideError, "Invalid sort direction"): validate_sort_dir('abc')

subject: VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-05 13:46:46.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/emc/test_emc_vmax.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/emc/emc_vmax_masking.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/d9ccfaef8ebec88c35e94f55fec7a631ae46a214', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.

There is a threading issue in Heat on a delete stack. All
detaches happen simultaneously. The fix locks the portion
of code to determine accurately, the number of volumes left
in the storage group, at any given time, to prevent
attempting to remove a volume that is the last in the
storage group.

Change-Id: I84164a9abac35d962408febbe8d3af759beb6a94
Closes-Bug: #1630535
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX driver - Heat detach issue.

There is a threading issue in Heat on a delete stack. All
detaches happen simultaneously. The fix locks the portion
of code to determine accurately, the number of volumes left
in the storage group, at any given time, to prevent
attempting to remove a volume that is the last in the
storage group.

Change-Id: I84164a9abac35d962408febbe8d3af759beb6a94
Closes-Bug: #1630535
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/20/382420/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @lockutils.synchronized(storageGroupName + 'remove', "emc-remove-sg", True) def do_remove_volume_from_sg(): volumeInstanceNames = self.get_devices_from_storage_group( conn, storageGroupInstanceName) numVolInStorageGroup = len(volumeInstanceNames) LOG.debug( "There are %(numVol)d volumes in the storage group " "%(maskingGroup)s.", {'numVol': numVolInStorageGroup, 'maskingGroup': storageGroupInstanceName}) if numVolInStorageGroup == 1: # Last volume in the storage group. self._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], extraSpecs) else: # Not the last volume so remove it from storage group self._multiple_vols_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], numVolInStorageGroup, extraSpecs) return do_remove_volume_from_sg() # Remove the volume from the storage group and delete the SG. self._remove_last_vol_and_delete_sg( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance.path, volumeName, extraSpecs) status = True
deleted_lines: volumeInstanceNames = self.get_devices_from_storage_group( conn, storageGroupInstanceName) numVolInStorageGroup = len(volumeInstanceNames) LOG.debug( "There are %(numVol)d volumes in the storage group " "%(maskingGroup)s.", {'numVol': numVolInStorageGroup, 'maskingGroup': storageGroupInstanceName}) if numVolInStorageGroup == 1: # Last volume in the storage group. self._last_vol_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], extraSpecs) else: # Not the last volume so remove it from storage group self._multiple_vols_in_SG( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, volumeInstance, volumeInstance['ElementName'], numVolInStorageGroup, extraSpecs) if mvInstanceName: maskingViewInstance = conn.GetInstance( mvInstanceName, LocalOnly=False) maskingViewName = maskingViewInstance['ElementName'] else: # Remove the volume from the storage group and delete the SG. self._remove_last_vol_and_delete_sg( conn, controllerConfigService, storageGroupInstanceName, storageGroupName, volumeInstance.path, volumeName, extraSpecs) status = True

commit_message:
Update upload_cirros to support multiple images

This change creates a puppet parser function to convert the
test_vm_image from hiera into a glance_image compatible array of hashes
that can be used with create_resources. Previously vmware deployments
included an extra TestVM to be uploaded but during the rewrite of the
upload_cirros task this ability was dropped.

Change-Id: I3f0f6da32134a4a15f2c4764c5334bb8e85309c8
Closes-Bug: #1635144
(cherry picked from commit 53f6229f636f607f5d7f8cd9f2e8669a73f9e6c2)

added_lines: $test_vm_images = hiera('test_vm_image') $glance_images = generate_glance_images(flatten([$test_vm_images])) $defaults = { 'ensure' => 'present', } create_resources(glance_image, $glance_images, $defaults)
deleted_lines: $test_vm_image = hiera_hash('test_vm_image') glance_image { $test_vm_image['img_name']: ensure => present, container_format => $test_vm_image['container_format'], disk_format => $test_vm_image['disk_format'], is_public => $test_vm_image['public'], min_ram => $test_vm_image['min_ram'], source => $test_vm_image['img_path'], properties => $test_vm_image['properties'], }

commit_message:
Add upgrade notes for new REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS

These two settings are required in REST_API_REQUIRED_SETTINGS
and need to be mentioned for deployments upgrading from
previous Horizon versions.

Change-Id: I9b80c3f299634fc54fafa1085a8ca65108740c51
Partial-Bug: 1632383

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Updated syntax for hap 1.5 and 1.6

The stats entry is no longer a special case in HAP 1.6 and needs to
follow the same bind syntax found in other HAP backends. This change
ensures that enabling stats does not break HAP.

Change-Id: I87cefc5032bf6064f6eab527f7b5cbe1b7fe704c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/97/389497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: listen stats bind {{ haproxy_stats_bind_address }}:{{ haproxy_stats_port }}

commit_message:
[networking] Update deployment examples

Update the deployment examples for Newton, particularly
by changing more commands to use the OpenStack client.

backport: newton

Change-Id: I567de49fb0592e6a34a1e74703bf77bcb4710b82

commit_message:
Add grenade configuration for neutron-fwaas

A grenade job is required for neutron stadium compliance, so therefore a
grenade job should be added for neutron-fwaas.  Plus, it's just a good
thing to have.

Change-Id: I196973df2260ebbc88f891d6b02830b987e7a9c7

commit_message:
Move octavia multinode scenario to check queue

After merging the changes that make
gate-octavia-v1-dsvm-scenario-multinode-nv possible in
Iecc38aa950e8b5a4c42db6b609820443efe437c2 and
I2c8b00a7377e3106f7cd1221202232a3621afe53, we'd like to move it
to the check queue as a non voting job, to gather statistics on
stability and compare to the non-multinode scenario.

Change-Id: If3a2458183b7cd15217770e1b1d1852633f9ede0
Closes-bug: 1628481

commit_message:
Support SSL and Insecure

Currently, Zaqarclient doesn't support SSL and insecure very well.
This patch fix it.

Implement blueprint: support-ssl-insecure

Change-Id: I2247fbbabc3afb7b5dccc2b48cd4e96864013a7e

Switch from tempest-lib to tempest

Since tempest-lib codebase is moved to tempest.lib from tempest-10.0.0
So we need to switch to tempest.

commit_message:
Fixed Shellcheck's warnings in murano-agent

Shellcheck complains like this:
meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-agent|26 col 3 warning|
In POSIX sh, 'local' is undefined. [SC2039] [sh/shellcheck]
And add quotes to prevent word splitting.

Change-Id: I99a296ebc33a101bcd0e4f9d824d3f217ec7c438
Closes-Bug: #1622384

commit_message:
Fix TypeError being throw by wait_ready in Engine System Agent.

Currently, wait_ready wrongly does call(template, False, timeout)
but the second param is expected to be a ResourceManager, leading
to the TypeError.

This fix replaces the wrong function call with
call_raw(template, timeout).

Change-Id: I57e92eae95efc3e68b51ea751d08dd87946f85cb
Closes-Bug: #1633176
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/29/386129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.call_raw(template, timeout)

commit_message:
Pin ARA to 0.9.1 temporarily

The next release of ARA (0.10.0) contains a change to the callback
plugin location that /should/ be backwards compatible but let's
control the update to the newer version to be safe and avoid
breaking the gate needlessly.

Change-Id: I32176166e8ebcbfdf0baa8bd7ec30e5ec6d795a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/67/389367/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo pip install ara==0.9.1

commit_message:
Fixes event ordering for alarm monitor and scale actions.

This commit adds code to support the below related to alarm
monitoring and scaling:
1.Consolidates the two event captures in the update_vnf_with_alarm
method into just a single event capture with alarm url details.
2.Captures events in update_vnf_with_alarm method when policy action
and alarm action name are missing.
3.Captures the event information for ActionAutoscalingHeat policy
action invocation and scaling action in the right time order.

Change-Id: Iea255a4f454fb0c721b152090514ad8ca8732890
Closes-Bug: #1629453

commit_message:
Cleanup of SecurityGroup classes

Commit Ifb70a118cef48c3c4cd313e22e907aa47bc51ad0 intended to remove some
classes, but without DeprecationWarnings. To prevent from possible
problems, if it would be now removed, added Warnings and included info,
about future removal.

Change-Id: Iacb93abc363bf638efc3acb5b29c02a7508bc43a
Related-Bug: #1444112

commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines[1]:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions.
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)

Change-Id: I192e339fadc6b738714697d1ae8673ebfb7abd79

commit_message:
Validate mapping exists when creating/updating a protocol

This patch validates that a mapping exists when adding or updating
a federation protocol.

Change-Id: I996f94d26eb0f2c679542ba13a03bbaa4442486a
Closes-Bug: #1571878
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/97/362397/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create_protocol(self, idp_id, protocol_id, protocol): # TODO(rderose): validate mapping exists return self.driver.create_protocol(idp_id, protocol_id, protocol) def update_protocol(self, idp_id, protocol_id, protocol): # TODO(rderose): validate mapping exists return self.driver.update_protocol(idp_id, protocol_id, protocol)

commit_message:
[Trivial] Refactor the using of dict.get() in the test assertion

In this patch, we will refactor the test assertions
in which there are dict.get(key), with a explicit
way(i.e. dict[key]), or assert the existence of key
directly with assertNotIn().

Change-Id: Ieb6137cb1cb3ec1c6e4e9d51fa0f74f17e363be9

added_lines: self.assertIsNotNone(volume['encryption_key_id']) self.assertEqual(db_vol_type['id'], volume['volume_type_id']) self.assertNotIn('locations', image) self.assertNotIn('locations', image) if driver_discard_flag is not None or config_discard_flag is True: self.assertEqual(expected_flag, conn_info['data']['discard']) else: self.assertNotIn('discard', conn_info['data'])
deleted_lines: self.assertIsNotNone(volume.get('encryption_key_id', None)) self.assertEqual(db_vol_type.get('id'), volume['volume_type_id']) self.assertIsNone(image.get('locations')) self.assertIsNone(image.get('locations')) self.assertEqual(expected_flag, conn_info['data'].get('discard'))
