commit_message:
Perfect the file information in openstack CLI

This patch is aim to perfect this file,it modify some invalid command
for volume operation.And it deprecated some[1] of cinder CLI instead of
use openstack CLI.

[1]:There are some CLI have not been realized for openstack CLI:
         cinder migrate
         cinder transfer
         cinder snapshot manage/unmanage

Change-Id: Id997f9bdd5ab4de225b01b8261e2fb80745e06a6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/68/375368/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ cinder migrate [--force-host-copy [<True|False>]] [--lock-volume [<True|False>]] <volume> <host>option'--lock-volume [<True|False>]' applies to the available volume. Enables or disables the termination of volume migration caused by other commands. True means it locks the volume state and does not allow the migration to be aborted. $ glance image-list +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+ | ID | Name | +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+ | 8bf4dc2a-bf78-4dd1-aefa-f3347cf638c8 | cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-uec | | 9ff9bb2e-3a1d-4d98-acb5-b1d3225aca6c | cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-uec-kernel | | 4b227119-68a1-4b28-8505-f94c6ea4c6dc | cirros-0.3.4-x86_64-uec-ramdisk | +--------------------------------------+---------------------------------+ #. Create a volume with 8 gibibytes (GiB) of space, and specify the $ cinder create --image-id 8bf4dc2a-bf78-4dd1-aefa-f3347cf638c8\ --name my-new-volume --availability-zone nova 8 +------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ | attachments | [] | | availability_zone | nova | | bootable | false | | consistencygroup_id | None | | created_at | 2016-09-23T07:52:42.000000 | | description | None | | encrypted | False | | id | bab4b0e0-ce3d-4d57-bf57-3c51319f5202 | | metadata | {} | | multiattach | False | | name | my-new-volume | | os-vol-tenant-attr:tenant_id | 3f670abbe9b34ca5b81db6e7b540b8d8 | | replication_status | disabled | | size | 8 | | snapshot_id | None | | source_volid | None | | status | creating | | updated_at | None | | user_id | fe19e3a9f63f4a14bd4697789247bbc5 | | volume_type | lvmdriver-1 | +------------------------------+--------------------------------------+ +--------------------------------------+-----------+---------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ | ID | Status | Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to | +--------------------------------------+-----------+---------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ | bab4b0e0-ce3d-4d57-bf57-3c51319f5202 | available | my-new-volume | 8 | lvmdriver-1 | true | | +--------------------------------------+-----------+---------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ $nova service-list $ cinder transfer-create <volume> <volume> Name or ID of volume to transfer. $ cinder transfer-delete transfer <transfer> Name or ID of transfer to delete. $ cinder snapshot-manage --id-type ID-TYPE \ --name NAME --description DESCRIPTION --metadata METADATA \ VOLUME_ID IDENTIFIER Cinder volume already exists in volume backend
deleted_lines: $ cinder migrate volumeID destinationHost --force-host-copy True|False $ nova image-list +-----------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------------------------+ | ID | Name | Status | Server | +-----------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------------------------+ | 397e713c-b95b-4186... | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec | ACTIVE | | | df430cc2-3406-4061... | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec-kernel | ACTIVE | | | 3cf852bd-2332-48f4... | cirros-0.3.2-x86_64-uec-ramdisk | ACTIVE | | | 7e5142af-1253-4634... | myCirrosImage | ACTIVE | 84c6e57d-a6b1-44b6-81... | | 89bcd424-9d15-4723... | mysnapshot | ACTIVE | f51ebd07-c33d-4951-87... | +-----------------------+---------------------------------+--------+--------------------------+#. Create a volume with 8 gibibytes (GiB) of space, and specify the $ cinder create 8 --display-name my-new-volume \ --image-id 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9 \ --availability-zone nova +---------------------+--------------------------------------+ | Property | Value | +---------------------+--------------------------------------+ | attachments | [] | | availability_zone | nova | | bootable | false | | created_at | 2013-07-25T17:02:12.472269 | | display_description | None | | display_name | my-new-volume | | id | 573e024d-5235-49ce-8332-be1576d323f8 | | image_id | 397e713c-b95b-4186-ad46-6126863ea0a9 | | metadata | {} | | size | 8 | | snapshot_id | None | | source_volid | None | | status | creating | | volume_type | None | +---------------------+--------------------------------------+ +-----------------+-----------+-----------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ | ID | Status | Display Name | Size | Volume Type | Bootable | Attached to | +-----------------+-----------+-----------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ | 573e024d-523... | available | my-new-volume | 8 | None | true | | | bd7cf584-45d... | available | my-bootable-vol | 8 | None | true | | +-----------------+-----------+-----------------+------+-------------+----------+-------------+ $ cinder transfer-create volumeID $ cinder transfer-delete transferID $ cinder snapshot-manage VOLUME_ID IDENTIFIER --id-type ID-TYPE \ --name NAME --description DESCRIPTION --metadata METADATA

commit_message:
Update .coveragerc after the removal of openstack directory

The openstack directory was used to keep codes from oslo-incubator,
we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use this directory any more.

Change-Id: Ifcf1a4388bd886d5d04675a54112857d99d43586

See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('receiver actions module', function() { var registry; beforeEach(module('horizon.app.core')); beforeEach(module('horizon.cluster')); beforeEach(inject(function($injector) { registry = $injector.get('horizon.framework.conf.resource-type-registry.service'); })); it('registers Delete as a batch action', function() { var actions = registry.getResourceType('OS::Senlin::Receiver').batchActions; expect(actionHasId(actions, 'batchDeleteReceiverAction')).toBe(true); }); function actionHasId(list, value) { return list.filter(matchesId).length === 1; function matchesId(action) { if (action.id === value) { return true; } } } }); })();

commit_message:
Allow POLICY_CHECK_FUNCTION to be disabled

Remove the current defaulting behaviour when it is set to None.

Change-Id: If8e018414f9f348980d0783f90afa039330e0e49
Closes-Bug: 1634677

As a related patch, I'll implement create/update/delete profile.

commit_message:
Support batch policy

A batch policy allow user to perform
an action with a batch of nodes each time.
For example: a cluster contains 100 nodes.
User can assign 80 as 'min_in_service',
which means there are 80 nodes in service
no matter what action you are performing,
and then process the rest of nodes in batch.

Change-Id: Ib62639e2233c8b27a08603448d8d6f2c8e9772c6
Implements: blueprint support-batching-policy

added_lines: import mathfrom senlin.common import scaleutils as sufrom senlin.engine import cluster as cm from senlin.objects import node as no def _cal_batch_size(self, cluster, current): batch_num = 0 batch_size = 0 diff = current - self.min_in_service # max_batch_size is -1 is not specified if self.max_batch_size == -1: batch_size = diff else: if diff < self.max_batch_size: batch_size = diff else: batch_size = self.max_batch_size batch_num = int(math.ceil(float(current) / float(batch_size))) return batch_size, batch_num def _pick_nodes(self, batch_size, batch_num, bad, good): nodes_list = [] for node in good: bad.expend(node.id) for num in range(batch_num): start = batch_size * num end = batch_size * (num + 1) if num < batch_num - 1: nodes_list.append(set(bad[start:end])) nodes_list.append(set(bad[start:])) return nodes_list def _update_plan(self, cluster, action): current = no.Node.count_by_cluster(action.context, cluster.id) # Here is a question, what is number of servers in good_list # less than min_in_service if current > 0: if current < self.min_in_service: msg = _('The parameter min_in_service is greater than ' 'current number of nodes.') return False, msg nodes_list = cluster.nodes bad_list, good_list = su.filter_error_nodes(nodes_list) else: msg = _('No node to be updated') return False, msg batch_size, batch_num = self._cal_batch_size(cluster, current) plan_list = self._pick_nodes(batch_size, batch_num, bad_list, good_list) plan = { 'pause_time': self.pause_time, 'plan': plan_list, } return True, plan cluster = cm.Cluster.load(action.context, cluster_id) # for updating if action.action == consts.CLUSTER_UPDATE: result, value = self._update_plan(cluster, action) if not result: pd = { 'status': base.CHECK_ERROR, 'reason': value, } else: pd = { 'status': base.CHECK_OK, 'reason': _('Batching request validated.'), } if action.action == consts.CLUSTER_UPDATE: pd['update'] = value action.data.update(pd) return

commit_message:
Use 'openstack security group list' to replace 'nova secgroup-list'

The command 'nova secgroup-list' is deprecated and will be
removed after Nova 15.0.0 is released, so this patch use
'openstack security group list' to replace it for cleanup.

Implements: blueprint use-openstack-command

Change-Id: I6e85a14c482320d21f89832e7c01dd60ab0bfc1f

Fix the issue that solum readme doc is not covered

In the toctree of source/index.rst, the reference of readme if 'readme',
but the filename is 'README.rst'.

commit_message:
Add ignore for .directories

This adds a global ignore for all .* directories
and whitelists known . files that we want.

This patch is copied from review 337890 and I found
it works better when using "**/.*" rather than "*/.*"

Change-Id: Ide22e47b5900d0ffec8c1abdec82fcf84ba5bc69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.privsep refs/changes/07/372007/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: **/.* !.coveragerc !.gitignore !.mailmap !.testr.conf

commit_message:
Add javascript tests for templateOverviewController

This patch adds javascript tests for the following modules.
 - horizon.dashboard.container-infra.cluster-templates.detail
   .overview.controller

In addition, it has changed the ".success()"  to the ".then()".

Change-Id: Ie619083f8fe4a8b2ad2d97dd0c2cbddde1653950

added_lines: /** * (c) Copyright 2016 NEC Corporation. * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may * not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain * a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software * distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT * WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the * License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations * under the License. */ (function() { 'use strict'; describe('cluster template overview controller', function() { var ctrl, glance, deferred; beforeEach(module('horizon.dashboard.container-infra.cluster-templates')); beforeEach(inject(function($controller, $q, $injector) { glance = $injector.get('horizon.app.core.openstack-service-api.glance'); deferred = $q.defer(); deferred.resolve({data: {image_id: 1},items:{1:{name:1,id:1},2:{name:2,id:2}}}); spyOn(glance, 'getImages').and.returnValue(deferred.promise); ctrl = $controller('ClusterTemplateOverviewController', { '$scope' : {context : {loadPromise: deferred.promise}} } ); })); it('sets ctrl', inject(function($timeout) { $timeout.flush(); expect(ctrl.cluster_template).toBeDefined(); expect(ctrl.image_uuid).toBeDefined(); })); }); })();

commit_message:
Work around bad libvirt-python wheel

The following package must always build from source:

- libvirt-python:
  A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities
  from the installed version of libvirt-bin, leading to
  nova-compute failing to start.

The pycparser upper constraint override is removed as
the patch to make it compatible with upper constraints
has merged.

Closes-Bug: #1625859
Change-Id: I3197f06839c9705574810ab616dff51924435da5
(cherry picked from commit faf78e457ee2be33fa275c4622067b9220fae903)

commit_message:
Fix no parameters app solum-worker gives KeyError

Now the app without parameters, the solum-worker will gives:
KeyError: 'parameters'

This patch fix it.

Change-Id: Iba08b6cf187e81fd7a58d14f9468fa64e88cf5da
Closes-Bug: #1633863
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/50/387050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: param_obj = app.get('parameters', {})

commit_message:
Use Password Generation provided by the Mistral workflows

Password generation was recently added to tripleo-common and the Mistral
workflows. This patch removes the generation code from tripleoclient as it is
no longer needed.

Closes-Bug: #1632013
Co-Authored-By: Dougal Matthews <dougal@redhat.com>
Depends-On: I94428d1deb000c65a1c0266d01f660b76d4a3ee5
Depends-On: I186217fd0e1125519149763e610d3efdff583388
Change-Id: Ibe76a40b4d19219aa8e4fc72ddde519ea6f6d2ba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/44/375544/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: utils.get_password(stack.stack_name, 'AdminPassword'), # TODO(rbrady): check usages of get_password utils.get_password(stack.stack_name, 'AdminToken'), utils.get_password(stack.stack_name, 'AdminPassword'), service_data['password'] = utils.get_password(stack.stack_name, password_field)
deleted_lines: def set_overcloud_passwords(self, stack_is_new, parameters): """Add passwords to the parameters dictionary :param parameters: A dictionary for the passwords to be added to :type parameters: dict """ undercloud_ceilometer_snmpd_password = utils.get_config_value( "auth", "undercloud_ceilometer_snmpd_password") if not undercloud_ceilometer_snmpd_password: self.log.warning("Undercloud ceilometer SNMPd password missing!") passwords = utils.generate_overcloud_passwords( create_password_file=stack_is_new) ceilometer_pass = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_PASSWORD'] ceilometer_secret = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEILOMETER_SECRET'] parameters['AdminPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD'] parameters['AdminToken'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN'] parameters['AodhPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_AODH_PASSWORD'] parameters['BarbicanPassword'] = ( passwords['OVERCLOUD_BARBICAN_PASSWORD']) parameters['CeilometerPassword'] = ceilometer_pass parameters['CeilometerMeteringSecret'] = ceilometer_secret parameters['CinderPassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_CINDER_PASSWORD'] parameters['GlancePassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_GLANCE_PASSWORD'] parameters['GnocchiPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_GNOCCHI_PASSWORD'] parameters['HAProxyStatsPassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_HAPROXY_STATS_PASSWORD'] parameters['HeatPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_HEAT_PASSWORD'] parameters['HeatStackDomainAdminPassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_HEAT_STACK_DOMAIN_PASSWORD'] parameters['IronicPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_IRONIC_PASSWORD'] parameters['MistralPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_MISTRAL_PASSWORD'] parameters['MysqlClustercheckPassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_MYSQL_CLUSTERCHECK_PASSWORD'] parameters['NeutronPassword'] = passwords[ 'OVERCLOUD_NEUTRON_PASSWORD'] parameters['NovaPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_NOVA_PASSWORD'] parameters['RabbitPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_RABBITMQ_PASSWORD'] parameters['RedisPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_REDIS_PASSWORD'] parameters['SaharaPassword'] = ( passwords['OVERCLOUD_SAHARA_PASSWORD']) parameters['SwiftHashSuffix'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_HASH'] parameters['SwiftPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_SWIFT_PASSWORD'] parameters['SnmpdReadonlyUserPassword'] = ( undercloud_ceilometer_snmpd_password) parameters['TrovePassword'] = ( passwords['OVERCLOUD_TROVE_PASSWORD']) parameters['ZaqarPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_ZAQAR_PASSWORD'] parameters['ManilaPassword'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_MANILA_PASSWORD'] parameters['NeutronMetadataProxySharedSecret'] = ( passwords['NEUTRON_METADATA_PROXY_SHARED_SECRET']) parameters['CephMonKey'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEPH_MON_KEY'] parameters['CephAdminKey'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEPH_ADMIN_KEY'] parameters['CephClientKey'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEPH_CLIENT_KEY'] parameters['CephRgwKey'] = passwords['OVERCLOUD_CEPH_RGW_KEY'] self.log.debug("Generating overcloud passwords") self.set_overcloud_passwords(stack_is_new, parameters) utils.get_password('OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD'), utils.get_password('OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_TOKEN'), utils.get_password('OVERCLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD'), service_data['password'] = utils.get_password( password_field)

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Solum already uses PBR:-
setuptools.setup(
    setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
    pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: Id5702fee8da7ceb5d2a9dc90b584ab56973b7ea1
Closes-Bug:#1608980

commit_message:
Redact password from opendaylight client logging

The opendaylight client is printing debug that can potentially contain
the user password. This should be redacted for security.

Change-Id: Id07b8fc6bc63dc6bb799c4489b938253c5e15476
Closes-Bug: #1634907

commit_message:
pacemaker/mysql: wait step 2 to remove default accounts

remove_default_accounts is a mysql::server parameter that, set to True,
will execute some MySQL commands to cleanup MySQL defaults accounts
created by packaging.
In order to successfully run the commands, we need MySQL up and running,
which is not the case at step 1 but at step 2.

This patch make sure we run the commands at step 2 on pacemaker master
only.

No change for scenarios without Pacemaker.

Change-Id: Ifad3cb40fd958d7ea606b9cd2ba4c8ec22a8e94e
Closes-Bug: #1633113
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/42/386042/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # remove_default_accounts parameter will execute some mysql commands # to remove the default accounts created by MySQL package. # We need MySQL running to run the commands successfully, so better to # wait step 2 before trying to run the commands. if $step >= 2 and $pacemaker_master { $remove_default_accounts = true } else { $remove_default_accounts = false } remove_default_accounts => $remove_default_accounts,

commit_message:
[Grenade] Update devstack and pre_test_hook

Make devstack grenade code use 'newton' as base branch for migration to
master (ocata).
After switch [1] to dummy driver we need to override defaults.
So, update pre_test_hook approach for saving configuration data properly.

[1] I2b698f69a29ef983b13534b2f4d393570be4dac8

Change-Id: Ie5fa0f78b0e3caa06d34a0822a8ed60b69406f9d
Closes-Bug: #1631412

commit_message:
add alarm.deletion notification

Aodh user may like to get Aodh alarm state immdiately via notification
from the message bus. Currently, alarm.creation and alarm.state_transition
notifications both exist, but the alarm.deletion does not.

Signed-off-by: dongwenjuan <dong.wenjuan@zte.com.cn>

Change-Id: Ibf9338203f4c4b41c52a2470ad51d2993b73deff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/54/387754/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: DELETE = 'deleted'

commit_message:
Change worker defaults to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from ::processorcount to the
new ::os_workers fact. ::os_workers is based on the number of processors
(currently cpu/4) but is capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.
This is a much more reasonable default in general and prevents excessive
resource consumption on systems with a large number of CPUs.

Change-Id: Ifa4f425091fae81204df68dd536f364efd647e3d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-swift refs/changes/29/382829/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-19 01:55:22.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/controller/worker/tasks/compute_tasks.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/tasks/test_network_tasks.py', 'octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/tasks/test_compute_tasks.py', 'octavia/controller/worker/tasks/network_tasks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/6cac86a9f9cc6ca0e4fb023e2d2e4964dbf36c2a', 'message': 'Fixes a revert failure in AllocateVIP task

The AllocateVIP task had an unhandled exception in the revert

load balancer in a PENDING_CREATE state instead of the desired

This patch catches the exceptions and logs the
situation, warning the operator that there may be orphaned objects.

A follow on patch will attempt to address the orphaned objects issue
tracked by: https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1624016

exceptions in the revert methods.

Change-Id: I267b0e884262678c67ccedb16251f12edcbdeb87
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes a revert failure in AllocateVIP task

The AllocateVIP task had an unhandled exception in the revert
method that would cause a revert flow to fail.  This left the
load balancer in a PENDING_CREATE state instead of the desired
ERROR end state. Two other revert instances also have this issue.

This patch catches the exceptions and logs the
situation, warning the operator that there may be orphaned objects.

A follow on patch will attempt to address the orphaned objects issue
tracked by: https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1624016

A follow on patch will address database repository calls with unhandled
exceptions in the revert methods.
Tracked by: https://bugs.launchpad.net/octavia/+bug/1624047

Closes-Bug: #1623737
Change-Id: I267b0e884262678c67ccedb16251f12edcbdeb87

commit_message:
Add missing Ironic auth plugin variable

The ironic auth plugin was missing cauing a deployment of ironic to fail
due to undefined variables in the nova role. This change adds the
missing variable allowing a typical Ironic deployment without issues.

Change-Id: Icd2397d608d62dc5498c76210dd18b5700087917
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit e457ba89baaa8a0aa3209413b977927b3ce2b18d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/74/389174/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add release notes target

Release notes for neutron-lib are meant to address neutron
developers and help them identify changes from one release
to another.

Change-Id: I51d2049643d3b35484d07f2f4aad7765f6dac958

commit_message:
Add unit test for repr encoding

This adds a unit test for bug 1514325 which is already
fixed but never had a unit test associated with the fix.

If you remove the fix from f5e792a9833e5139ee1f66b2ac1e55b251c42533
then this new test will fail as expected.

Change-Id: I6a382e9fad79b8d3c68cfa584addf67bc7c051df
Related-Bug: #1514325

commit_message:
Make pid_max settable on OSD nodes.

On OSD nodes during recovery you can ovewhelm the default PID max of
32k. The docs recommend setting to the largest possible value, 4194303.
By default this will not be set.

http://docs.ceph.com/docs/jewel/rados/troubleshooting/troubleshooting-osd/

Change-Id: Id7714e8d237db2137fdc32002ab7ae373fb81357
Closes-Bug: #1362825

commit_message:
Add new hiera agent hook to overcloud images.

This patch adds the package for the new heat agent hiera hook
to the overcloud image. This is a move towards helping us optimize the
way Hiera is configured on the overcloud nodes.

Depends-On: I21639f6aadabf9e49f40d1bb0b1d0edcfc4dbc5e

Change-Id: Ia1864933235152b7e899c4442534879f8e22240d
Partial-bug: #1596373

subject: Throttle update_auditor_status calls
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-13 06:20:58.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_diskfile.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/5941f26ceac9c62c54f3b5bb52f0bb53feddd355', 'message': 'Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.

Cherry-picked from master/77f5b201248c0684d87289540d3f94873f5c5e38.

Closes-Bug: 1631352
Change-Id: Ib61ec9cd945e6b2d28756f6ca47801674a7e6060
'}]
commit_message:
Throttle update_auditor_status calls

If there are quite a few nearly empty partitions per disk you might see
some write load even if your cluster is unused. The auditor will update
the status file after every partition, and this might happen multiple
times within a second if there is not much data stored yet.

This patch throttles updates, and will only write out an updated status
if the file was last updated more than a minute ago.

Cherry-picked from master/77f5b201248c0684d87289540d3f94873f5c5e38.

Closes-Bug: 1631352
Change-Id: Ib61ec9cd945e6b2d28756f6ca47801674a7e6060
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/79/385779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MIN_TIME_UPDATE_AUDITOR_STATUS = 60 mtime = os.stat(auditor_status).st_mtime except OSError: mtime = 0 recently_updated = (mtime + MIN_TIME_UPDATE_AUDITOR_STATUS) > time.time() if recently_updated and len(partitions) > 0: if logger: logger.debug( 'Skipping the update of recently changed %s' % auditor_status) return try:

The retry_logic in do_request catches neutronclient errors, but if a
SessionClient is being used, nothing throws neutronclient errors -

Change-Id: If16e50ee53279652fbdfc2d13d5509f46a54124a

'}]
commit_message:
Handle keystoneauth exceptions in retry logic

The retry_logic in do_request catches neutronclient errors, but if a
SessionClient is being used, nothing throws neutronclient errors -
instead keystoneauth Session throws keystoneauth exceptions.

Add the keystoneauth.exceptions.ConnectionError to the things that
handle the error and retry.

Change-Id: If16e50ee53279652fbdfc2d13d5509f46a54124a
(cherry picked from commit b8a05333ddc4e248e18080750e3cfa9cbedbca53)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-neutronclient refs/changes/10/378010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from keystoneauth1 import exceptions as ksa_exc except (exceptions.ConnectionFailed, ksa_exc.ConnectionError):

Change-Id: Id3debd30aec0c3925c92332afe99fb092c006d1a

commit_message:
Add user_domain_name and project_domain_name

- Add user_domain_name and project_domain_name set to 'Default' by
default.
- Change project_domain_id and user_domain_id to be os_service_default.

This change is required with latest Keystone, as we need to specify
domain names to authentificate against Keystone.

Change-Id: Id3debd30aec0c3925c92332afe99fb092c006d1a
(cherry picked from commit 4b32158c1e46d0fa2aaf4a42d509a7840462f33e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/90/389290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - Add user_domain_name and project_domain_name parameters.

commit_message:
Skip setting up handler for SIGUSR1 on Windows

SIGUSR1 does not exist on Windows. Trying to access
signal.SIGUSR1 on Windows results in an AttributeError.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-windows-support

Change-Id: I43701611e0c23e20cad80ee87aff9d5672ae4e14
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/21/317921/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if hasattr(signal, 'SIGUSR1'): # Windows does not have this signal. signal.signal(signal.SIGUSR1, self._handle_sigusr1)

commit_message:
Properly get the conf.d folder

Currently, it only loads the conf.d folder based on
the statically defined default config file location.

It should take into account the config-file argument
passed.

The Config object already has a get_confd_path method
which does this, and it should be used instead.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-windows-support

Change-Id: I406b1773920d0b546956452da5003b3f27de8bc0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/20/317920/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: return configuration.get_config().get_confd_path() except PathNotFound: pass path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'conf.d')
deleted_lines: path = os.path.join(os.path.dirname(configuration.DEFAULT_CONFIG_FILE), 'conf.d') path2 = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), 'conf.d') elif os.path.exists(path2): return path2

commit_message:
mysql-wss: fixed node score calculation

There was a typo near !/${OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE}:/
Also it eliminates unnecessary forks as node score
is placed in last column of a string.

Change-Id: I3c4efacb1cf6038a14cb6834ed94903bc9f92466
Closes-Bug: #1623935
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/97/370797/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NODE_SCORE=`crm_simulate -Ls | awk "/${OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE}/ && /clone_color/ && ! /${OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE}:/ && /${NODE}/" | sed -r -e 's/.*score on (.*)/\1/' | awk -F ':' '{print $2}' | tr -d '[:space:]'`
deleted_lines: NODE_SCORE=`crm_simulate -Ls | awk "/${OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE}/ && /clone_color/ && !/${OCF_RESOURCE_INSTANCE}:/ && /${NODE}/" | sed -r -e 's/.*score on (.*)/\1/' | awk -F ':' '{print $2}' | tr -d '[:space:]'`

commit_message:
Adding hugepage and NUMA support check for aarch64

Nova ignores aarch64 while verifying for hugepage and NUMA support.
AARCH64 also supports hugepage and NUMA on the same libvirt versions as of x86.
Hence adding this chek for aarch64 also.

Change-Id: I7b5ae1dbdca4fdd0aee2eefd4099c4c4953b609a
Closes-bug: #1623871
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/372304/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if newname == "aarch64": newname = AARCH64

commit_message:

commit_message:
set 0600 permissions on fernet keys & folder

Fernet keys and the fernet key folder should be managed with permissions
0600 for more security on the keys. Same for the credentials folder and
credentials.

Change-Id: I42b868d27582d1edec22fd93cb1c86f489e144a2

commit_message:
Bump entercloud max servers up from 0

All the images are built and mirrors are configured, time to bump the
number of maxservers on all the regions so these can start being used.

They have asked us to use these in the following order of preference,
so the maxservers we're adding to each reflects this:

1. nl-ams1
2. de-fra1
3. it-mil1

Change-Id: Ic2c57fbb0c29ea0af228c4c319731e66bfb55b2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/53/389353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max-servers: 12 max-servers: 11 max-servers: 10

commit_message:
C10k load testing environment script

Including a script to reproduce our test environment from c10k testing.
Also including two new features to test httpd: arbitrary response delay
for slow connections and path to reset counters for subsequent tests
with the same backend instances.

Change-Id: I5171d1addcc546050213d96bf7d00af0ff1bad80

commit_message:
Revise coverage guidelines

Blind 100% unit coverage hinders developement and has
no added benefits, especially  when coverage can be
achieved by other means.

Change-Id: I216286fd55ea6a6a71a01f56c918bf04298ef5f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/11/389311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: a global unit coverage greater than 90%, and a per-module coverage greater than 80%. If neutron does not yet have a test, it needs to be added. Note that tests on things like constants are uninteresting, but any code or interface should have a unit test, if you cannot tell for sure that it is not going to be traversed in some alternative way (e.g. tempest/functional coverage).
deleted_lines: 100% unit coverage on this library, so if neutron does not yet have a test, it needs to be added. Note that tests on things like constants are uninteresting, but any code or interface should have a unit test.

commit_message:
Drop MANIFEST.in - it's not needed by pbr

Neutron-lbaas already uses PBR:- setuptools.setup(
	setup_requires=['pbr>=1.8'],
	pbr=True)

This patch removes `MANIFEST.in` file as pbr generates a
sensible manifest from git files and some standard files
and it removes the need for an explicit `MANIFEST.in` file.

Change-Id: I0e59cd1b89329042097c1ab03e83b565a99ed350
Closes-Bug: #1608980

commit_message:
Add migrate_uri for invoking the migration

Add migrate_uri parameter in Guest.migrate method, to indicate
the URI where we want to stablish the connection in a non-tunneled
migration.

Change-Id: I6c2ad0170d90560d7d710b578c45287e78c682d1
Closes-Bug: #1614063

commit_message:
Enable pcsd_mode for RHEL >= 6.6

As mentioned at
https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_Enterprise_Linux/6/html/Configuring_the_Red_Hat_High_Availability_Add-On_with_Pacemaker/ch-overview-HAAR.html
from update 6 also EL6 systems are using pcs as in EL7.

Change-Id: I99580cccb515822cd4b8f933ce7396bcae9601ae
Closes-Bug: 1557573
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-pacemaker refs/changes/31/292931/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # in el6.6, $pcsd_mode should be true if $::os['release']['minor'] >= 6 { $pcsd_mode = true } else { $pcsd_mode = false }
deleted_lines: # TODO in el6.6, $pcsd_mode should be true $pcsd_mode = false

commit_message:
Ensure wget is installed for RGW Keystone integration

The minimal install of CentOS does not include wget causing the
exec resources to fail.  This patch ensures that it is installed
on the operating system.

Change-Id: I55b8a227bbf309f99583261eb879e6a1b6e602de

commit_message:
Change conf from create to ensure

In order to help minimize issues with create/duplicates we need to switch
from create_resources to ensure_resources

Change-Id: I3238d30ad90b67107e6a13e3655e590ee802c6ff

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I1bcbb80d0540faca79a3c46f4bcae2e63ebea3ca

subject: Add os-brick to glance_pip_packages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 18:14:38.000000000', 'files': ['defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance/commit/22dfd3abb03c6143b273256931bc01bc849af1d6', 'message': 'Add os-brick to glance_pip_packages

In order to use cinder as a glance back-end, the os-brick
python package is required.

While the inclusion of the package could be dynamically
included, we already have cinder listed as an additional
back-end by default and the cost of including this library
by default is minimal, so this opts to keep it simple and
just always include it.

The python package list is also sorted alphabetically for
easier package name finding in the future.

Change-Id: Id7e4638e1addf902e6027f6375c794fd56a5039d
Closes-Bug: #1634497
(cherry picked from commit 2c7d0e4dea602dfe94b3cbb0bd1a6be381d369e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Add os-brick to glance_pip_packages

In order to use cinder as a glance back-end, the os-brick
python package is required.

While the inclusion of the package could be dynamically
included, we already have cinder listed as an additional
back-end by default and the cost of including this library
by default is minimal, so this opts to keep it simple and
just always include it.

The python package list is also sorted alphabetically for
easier package name finding in the future.

Change-Id: Id7e4638e1addf902e6027f6375c794fd56a5039d
Closes-Bug: #1634497
(cherry picked from commit 2c7d0e4dea602dfe94b3cbb0bd1a6be381d369e4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance refs/changes/05/389305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Clear cached selected items on swift objects table

The swift objects/folders table was caching the selected
items because it was broadcasting the wrong hzTable event
to clear them when needed.

Change-Id: Ie6d594718d6f2ca50f59d44d20978ccdb28734f5
Closes-Bug: #1629993
(cherry picked from commit d556a82ee2929d4a48e845311f12837f985bdca2)

added_lines: 'horizon.framework.widgets.table.events', hzTableEvents, $scope.$broadcast(hzTableEvents.CLEAR_SELECTIONS);

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: I0fa79f3722a12b1ab552edf50daae72fe34e2ac6

subject: ceph::repo does not purge added yum repo files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 17:53:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/repo.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph/commit/c155c9688dd30e9e3dd17d5ffa6c99bb262b4e7b', 'message': 'ceph::repo does not purge added yum repo files

The ceph::repo class will only disable a yum class when
ensure is set to true to the class. This patch passes
"ensure => $ensure" to the yumrepo class

Change-Id: Ic4c7140f5901b56987b98adab0cb80778bff0232
'}]
commit_message:
ceph::repo does not purge added yum repo files

The ceph::repo class will only disable a yum class when
ensure is set to true to the class. This patch passes
"ensure => $ensure" to the yumrepo class

Change-Id: Ic4c7140f5901b56987b98adab0cb80778bff0232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/01/311801/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ensure => $ensure, ensure => $ensure,

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 15:21:27.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/_independent/kuryr.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/commit/34aeaccdce7834dfc2bd8705a0c5a2cff472cec9', 'message': 'fix the tarball-base for kuryr-lib

The kuryr repo actually publishes a tarball with the name kuryr-lib, so
the tarball link is being built incorrectly using the default logic.
Fix the base name so the links are built correctly.

Change-Id: I50d3f1083e6281f9cf56c6814223a576c9943736
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix the tarball-base for kuryr-lib

The kuryr repo actually publishes a tarball with the name kuryr-lib, so
the tarball link is being built incorrectly using the default logic.
Fix the base name so the links are built correctly.

Change-Id: I50d3f1083e6281f9cf56c6814223a576c9943736
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/59/388759/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tarball-base: kuryr-lib

commit_message:
ensure pike ptg reference has a unique target name

There are p-ptg targets in the ocata and pike schedule pages, so change
the ocata name to make it unique.

Change-Id: I6d059127ae38501fcb4e1224124ada7984a40b1c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use centralised Ansible test scripts

This patch consumes the centralised Ansible test scripts
implemented in https://review.openstack.org/381853

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/382315
- https://review.openstack.org/388449

Change-Id: Iea3a6f853b2347b1463644c89136a313711e7785
(cherry picked from commit 7323a6bec2f72f2684a4acb65bb606311d6eba6b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest refs/changes/51/389151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEST_IDEMPOTENCE=false {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-syntax.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-lint.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh"
deleted_lines: commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-env-prep.sh" {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-lint {toxinidir} [testenv:func_base] # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} [testenv:func_logs] commands = bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh"# Ignore_errors is set to true so that the logs are collected at the # end of the run. This will not produce a false positive. Any # exception will be mark the run as failed and exit 1 after all of # the commands have been iterated through. ignore_errors = True # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command} {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/tempest-overrides.yml \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml -vvvv {[testenv:func_logs]commands}

commit_message:
Disables Neutron ML2 config on Compute for OpenDaylight

This is not needed with ODL and actually triggers deployments to fail
due to missing ODL username/password info on compute nodes.

Depends-On: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2

Closes-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ib88e8ef91c393d30c44b86a932103f5a294bc547
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/30/386830/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronCorePlugin: OS::Heat::None

commit_message:
Fixes missing ODL ML2 Authentication info

Without this, neutron-server fails to start and communication will not
work to ODL REST.

Parital-Bug: 1633630

Change-Id: Ifd906db4e6062ac271c2147fe1149b1009d06ae2
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

added_lines: odl_username => hiera('opendaylight::username'), odl_password => hiera('opendaylight::password'), odl_url => "${conn_proto}://${odl_url_ip}:${odl_port}/controller/nb/v2/neutron";

commit_message:
Remove new_id() in test_revoke

Since new_id() and uuid.uuid4().hex there is no need for two different
lines of code which do the same thing. Removing new_id() makes the
code more consistant and easier for readability purposes.

Change-Id: Iff214099e82a9ade2f07e458e35932441f1d12eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/41/389241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: audit_chain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_ids.append(uuid.uuid4().hex) project_ids.append(uuid.uuid4().hex) role_ids.append(uuid.uuid4().hex) user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex token_data_u2[field_name] = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id1 = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id2 = uuid.uuid4().hex project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project_id = uuid.uuid4().hex project_domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_id = uuid.uuid4().hex user_domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex domain_id = uuid.uuid4().hex self._revoke_by_project_role_assignment(uuid.uuid4().hex, uuid.uuid4().hex)) self._revoke_by_domain_role_assignment(uuid.uuid4().hex, uuid.uuid4().hex)) self._revoke_by_domain_role_assignment(uuid.uuid4().hex, uuid.uuid4().hex)) self._revoke_by_user_and_project(uuid.uuid4().hex, uuid.uuid4().hex))
deleted_lines: def _new_id(): return uuid.uuid4().hex audit_chain_id = _new_id() user_ids.append(_new_id()) project_ids.append(_new_id()) role_ids.append(_new_id()) user_id = _new_id() token_data_u2[field_name] = _new_id() user_id1 = _new_id() user_id2 = _new_id() project_id = _new_id() user_id = _new_id() domain_id = _new_id() user_id = _new_id() user_domain_id = _new_id() project_id = _new_id() project_domain_id = _new_id() user_id = _new_id() user_domain_id = _new_id() domain_id = _new_id() self._revoke_by_project_role_assignment(_new_id(), _new_id())) self._revoke_by_domain_role_assignment(_new_id(), _new_id())) self._revoke_by_domain_role_assignment(_new_id(), _new_id())) self._revoke_by_user_and_project(_new_id(), _new_id()))

commit_message:
Only disable Neutron tests when our Grenade is running

Unconditionally disabling it in code disables neutron for everyone
importing our plugin.

Change-Id: I468af14f42b6d9227179e921f5a3ccea2cae0d66
Partial-Bug: #1621791
(cherry picked from commit 4eb77865ab140c7a10e33c0a6fed201e39bac183)

subject: Fix neutron_agent IP to be neutron_server IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-20 12:52:10.000000000', 'files': ['test-vars.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests/commit/ce438242ded810cdd4f3dc75f56c86ebce4b70cf', 'message': 'Fix neutron_agent IP to be neutron_server IP

The neutron_agent group was being used to determine the endpoint for
neutron server on port 9696. This worked because all neutron test
installs had the neutron_agent and neutron_server on the same IP.

The calico testing does not install neutron_agent however, as a result
this fails, this PR fixes that to point to the neutron_server (which is
the correct location for the endpoint).

Change-Id: I6f1f21cdbccc151b0305067085fe7645c6b0b504
(cherry picked from commit 22e02044d013d67637e32aa219633078421af920)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron_agent IP to be neutron_server IP

The neutron_agent group was being used to determine the endpoint for
neutron server on port 9696. This worked because all neutron test
installs had the neutron_agent and neutron_server on the same IP.

The calico testing does not install neutron_agent however, as a result
this fails, this PR fixes that to point to the neutron_server (which is
the correct location for the endpoint).

Change-Id: I6f1f21cdbccc151b0305067085fe7645c6b0b504
(cherry picked from commit 22e02044d013d67637e32aa219633078421af920)

added_lines: test_neutron_server_group: "{{ ((groups['neutron_server'] is defined) and (groups['neutron_server'] | length > 0)) | ternary('neutron_server', 'all_containers') }}"test_neutron_server_host: "{{ hostvars[groups[test_neutron_server_group][0]]['ansible_host'] }}"neutron_management_address: "{{ test_neutron_server_host }}"neutron_service_publicuri: "http://{{ test_neutron_server_host }}:9696"neutron_service_adminuri: "http://{{ test_neutron_server_host }}:9696"neutron_service_internaluri: "http://{{ test_neutron_server_host }}:9696"
deleted_lines: test_neutron_agent_group: "{{ ((groups['neutron_agent'] is defined) and (groups['neutron_agent'] | length > 0)) | ternary('neutron_agent', 'all_containers') }}"test_neutron_agent_host: "{{ hostvars[groups[test_neutron_agent_group][0]]['ansible_host'] }}"neutron_management_address: "{{ test_neutron_agent_host }}"neutron_service_publicuri: "http://{{ test_neutron_agent_host }}:9696"neutron_service_adminuri: "http://{{ test_neutron_agent_host }}:9696"neutron_service_internaluri: "http://{{ test_neutron_agent_host }}:9696"

commit_message:
Add remove known_hosts in the instruction for Multi-Node AIO

Add the rm ~/.ssh/known_hosts for the Rerunning the build script
part in the instruction.

Change-Id: Iba7610e00f07bb61cd8b11892e208ea4c67a1d75
Closes-Bug: #1635037

commit_message:
Enhanced the setup-cobbler.sh

Replace the service xinetd stop and start to service xinetd restart
, the stop will cause the unknow instance error and stop the
rebuild

Change-Id: I1a8a7a72f51b3d4dcdca3b0158f7771efd567032
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/96/389296/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: service xinetd stop service xinetd start

Correct help string of the subnet pool list options

Correct help string of subnet pool list options, from
"subnets" to "subnet pools".

Change-Id: Ic6dd6649f411748cd0c6e6b08f0451c8a0fa220f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-18 15:32:37.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/rgw.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph/commit/803e151736f506aa57820e457448cc66b408e5d4', 'message': "Notify radosgw service on configuration change

The ceph-radosgw service should be notified on configuration change else
it won't be able to pick-up new/changed configuration.

Change-Id: I47a5ddaae95a151ebd7fa3ea740a616f8d58ad36
"}]
commit_message:
Notify radosgw service on configuration change

The ceph-radosgw service should be notified on configuration change else
it won't be able to pick-up new/changed configuration.

Change-Id: I47a5ddaae95a151ebd7fa3ea740a616f8d58ad36
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/80/388080/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Ceph_config<||> ~> Service<| tag == 'ceph-radosgw' |>

commit_message:
Use centralised Ansible test scripts

This patch consumes the centralised Ansible test scripts
implemented in https://review.openstack.org/381853

Combined backport of:
- https://review.openstack.org/382314
- https://review.openstack.org/388447

Change-Id: Icf49b6e72f6355903225b1163802967865ee587d
(cherry picked from commit 902f28e16e9b8a83ee085529a1fa12c7551378f8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_swift refs/changes/47/389147/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEST_IDEMPOTENCE=false TEST_PLAYBOOK={toxinidir}/tests/test.yml {toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-functional.ymlcommands= {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-syntax.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-lint.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh" setenv = {[testenv]setenv} ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=-vvv -e swift_pypy_enabled=True {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-multi_reg.sh"
deleted_lines: commands =# The max-line-length is being set at a greater width in order to accommodate # jinja templating in python files, especially in the shebang. max-line-length = 120commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-env-prep.sh" {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-lint {toxinidir} [testenv:func_base] # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} [testenv:func_logs] commands = bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh"# Ignore_errors is set to true so that the logs are collected at the # end of the run. This will not produce a false positive. Any # exception will be mark the run as failed and exit 1 after all of # the commands have been iterated through. ignore_errors = True # NOTE(andymccr): this will test standard Swift install. install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command} {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml -vvvv ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-functional.yml -vvvv {[testenv:func_logs]commands} # NOTE(andymccr): this will test Swift running in pypy.# Ignore_errors is set to true so that the logs are collected at the # end of the run. This will not produce a false positive. Any # exception will be mark the run as failed and exit 1 after all of # the commands have been iterated through. ignore_errors = True install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command} {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides.yml \ -e "swift_pypy_enabled=True" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml -vvvv ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides.yml \ -e "swift_pypy_enabled=True" \ {toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-functional.yml -vvvv {[testenv:func_logs]commands} # NOTE(andmccr): this will test a MR Swift deploy.# Ignore_errors is set to true so that the logs are collected at the # end of the run. This will not produce a false positive. Any # exception will be mark the run as failed and exit 1 after all of # the commands have been iterated through. ignore_errors = True install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command} {[testenv:ansible]commands} # Setup the host and Region A # NB we run against swift_all only since region B hosts don't exist yet. ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory_MR_A \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e "swift_do_setup=True" \ -e "swift_do_sync=False" \ -e "swift_groups='swift_all'" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides-MR-A.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml -vvvv # Setup region B Swift only and sync rings. ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory_MR_B \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides-MR-B.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/common/test-install-swift.yml -vvvv # Sync rings from region A ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory_MR_A \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e "swift_do_setup=False" \ -e "swift_do_sync=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides-MR-A.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/common/test-install-swift.yml -vvvv # Run functional tests against region A ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory_MR_A \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides-MR-A.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-functional.yml -vvvv # Run functional tests against region B ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory_MR_B \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ -e @{toxinidir}/tests/swift-overrides-MR-B.yml \ {toxinidir}/tests/test-swift-functional.yml -vvvv {[testenv:func_logs]commands}

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-security refs/changes/66/389166/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: TEST_CHECK_MODE=true TEST_IDEMPOTENCE=true {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-syntax.sh" {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-lint.sh"setenv = {[testenv]setenv} # https://review.openstack.org/354819 merges. ANSIBLE_PARAMETERS=--skip-tags V-38462,V-38660,V-38620 commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-functional.sh"
deleted_lines: commands = {[testenv:tests_clone]commands} bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-ansible-env-prep.sh" {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ --syntax-check \ --list-tasks \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml {[testenv:ansible]commands} ansible-lint {toxinidir} [testenv:func_base] # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = pip install -U --force-reinstall {opts} {packages} [testenv:func_logs] commands = bash -c "{toxinidir}/tests/common/test-log-collect.sh"# Ignore_errors is set to true so that the logs are collected at the # end of the run. This will not produce a false positive. Any # exception will be mark the run as failed and exit 1 after all of # the commands have been iterated through. ignore_errors = True # NOTE(odyssey4me): this target does not use constraints because # it doesn't work in OpenStack-CI yet. Once that's fixed, we can # drop the install_command. install_command = {[testenv:func_base]install_command}commands = {[testenv:ansible]commands} # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/354819/ merges. ansible-playbook --check \ -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ --skip-tag V-38462,V-38660,V-38620 \ {toxinidir}/tests/test_check.yml ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ --skip-tag V-38462,V-38660,V-38620 \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml bash -c 'ansible-playbook -i {toxinidir}/tests/inventory \ -e "install_test_packages=True" \ --skip-tag V-38462,V-38660,V-38620 \ {toxinidir}/tests/test.yml \ | tee /tmp/idempotence_test_output.txt' bash -c 'grep -q "changed=0.*failed=0" /tmp/idempotence_test_output.txt \ && (echo "Idempotence test: pass" && exit 0) \ || (echo "Idempotence test: fail" && exit 1)' {[testenv:func_logs]commands}

commit_message:
Retire neutron-pd-driver

As anticipated in [1] and communicated in [2], it is time
this project be retired. This is communicated once more in
[3]. The ACL change is required to take ownership of
retirement step [4], in case the pd-driver core team is
not responsive.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312199/5/specs/newton/neutron-stadium.rst@291
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-September/104671.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/106112.html
[4] I2b44230be9b5d7395de35a0113e8641973abead9

Change-Id: If3b1f00806cc7c3260355b7bfb40789ce14d9d28

commit_message:
This is the initial commit for puppet-cloudkitty.

It has been automatically generated using cookiecutter[1] and msync[2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-openstack-cookiecutter
[2] https://github.com/openstack/puppet-modulesync-configs

Change-Id: I43e8be43f6c77d55ff0c5879344020942eb9cf43

commit_message:
ovsfw: Add a dl_type match for action=ct flows

Recently ovs has been changed to require a dl_type match for
action=ct flows.

Change-Id: I9040d8c50ee30f5daef7ea931a28cd0cf7855f3e
Closes-bug: #1634757

commit_message:
Avoid string actions on non-string objects

When config is coming from a clouds.yaml file, Python's yaml parser may
turn the version into an int if it is not quoted in the yaml. Ensure
that we set the value to a string before interacting with it.

Also fix a possible string action on a None object.

Change-Id: Ibf02a85d89c95ba76688b3f5c417f861173008d5
Closes-Bug: #1634986

commit_message:
Enforce application/json content type on quota set

When receiving an unexpected content type header, the
quota controller returned 500 internal server error.
This patch checks for the supported content type so
the appropriate 415 bad type error code is returned.

Change-Id: If7014767300ce5bf7c5de57c91453c4fd2b1d85d
Closes-bug: 1609985

commit_message:
Default to Keystone authentication

This configures Barbican to use Keystone authentication by
default and updates documentation accordingly.

Change-Id: Ie0a1995b971371d18238138575629eeee1a36392
Closes-Bug: #1595428
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/73/333173/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: As of OpenStack Newton, Barbican will default to using Keystone like every other OpenStack service for identity and access control. Nonetheless, sometimes it may be useful to run barbican without any authentication service for development purpose. To this end, `barbican-api-paste.ini` contains a filter pipeline without any authentication (no auth mode):To enable this pipe line proceed as follows: 1. Turn off any active instances of Barbican 2. Edit ``/etc/barbican/barbican-api-paste.ini`` Change the pipeline ``/v1`` value from authenticated ``barbican-api-keystone`` to the unauthenticated ``barbican_api`` .. code-block:: ini [composite:main] use = egg:Paste#urlmap /: barbican_version /v1: barbican_api
deleted_lines: Generally barbican can be configured to use keystone like every other OpenStack services for identity and access control. Sometimes it may be useful to run barbican without any authentication service for development purpose. By default, configuration in :file:`barbican-api-paste.ini` sets barbican without any authentication (no auth mode), for example:

commit_message:
Switch to stdlib validate_legacy

The stdlib module has deprecated all the validate_* functions and
recommends the use of validate_legacy as a replacement. This change
updates the module to use validate_legacy instead of the existing
validate calls.

Change-Id: I88fd43878744f3e18ee8a733996848e76d0f1c71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-aodh refs/changes/71/389271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: validate_legacy("Hash", "validate_hash", $policies)

commit_message:
add version number verification for fuel projects

Add version number verification rules for release-type==fuel, matching
the standard rules.

Make the error message that's reported for an unknown release-type
clearer.

Change-Id: Ia32b7badc36f29a70c3c8b5aa32649dd9e129026
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/08/388808/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _VALIDATORS['fuel'] = _VALIDATORS['std'] yield 'Release Type %r not valid using \'std\' instead' % release_type
deleted_lines: yield 'Release Type %s not valid using \'std\'' % release_type

commit_message:
Add os-brick to glance_pip_packages

In order to use cinder as a glance back-end, the os-brick
python package is required.

While the inclusion of the package could be dynamically
included, we already have cinder listed as an additional
back-end by default and the cost of including this library
by default is minimal, so this opts to keep it simple and
just always include it.

The python package list is also sorted alphabetically for
easier package name finding in the future.

Change-Id: Id7e4638e1addf902e6027f6375c794fd56a5039d
Closes-Bug: #1634497

commit_message:
Add ability to set upper constraints file

When this role executes the installation of packages, upper
constraints should be used.

This patch adds the ability to set an upper constraint
file URL/path.

The tox config is also adjusted to ensure that it makes
use of upper constraints when installing requirements.

Backport note:
The var lxc_hosts_pip_install_options is not included as it
was added to support CentOS7's LXC build process and is not
necessary to include.

Change-Id: I3cebfe7d8aec84dc533f208f9bdf0a5eb52d9dcd
(cherry picked from commit 3b42216431ed288989e84f0a516e5d3eaccb827c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/68/389068/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extra_args: >- {{ (pip_install_upper_constraints is defined) | ternary('--constraint ' + pip_install_upper_constraints | default(''),'') }} {{ pip_install_options | default('') }}

commit_message:
Add ability to set upper constraints file

When this role executes the installation of packages, upper
constraints should be used.

This patch adds the ability to set an upper constraint
file URL/path.

The tox config is also adjusted to ensure that it makes
use of upper constraints when installing requirements.

Backport note:
The var lxc_hosts_pip_install_options is not included as it
was added to support CentOS7's LXC build process and is not
necessary to include.

Change-Id: I3cebfe7d8aec84dc533f208f9bdf0a5eb52d9dcd
(cherry picked from commit 3b42216431ed288989e84f0a516e5d3eaccb827c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/67/389067/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Roll-up of multiple fixes for os_ceilometer role

The ceilometer/api/app.wsgi file upstream was modified and broke the
ceilometer role such that the ceilometer api will not start. This
change fixes the role by updating the template derived from that file
to match the new invocation method.

An example of the error being remedied can be seen in patch set 1 of
Related-Change: Ieb5569982f080446295cecc33fb70c6b5d1cb9d6

Additionally, ceilometer-api is served with Apache mod_wsgi so an
init script shouldn't be created.

Also, the ceilometer_db_type now defaults to blank which will omit
the [database] group from the ceilometer.conf which matches the new
upstream default. The db type is overridden as mongodb for testing.

Also fixes an issue in inventory introduced by Change:
Ia74bbcac35c27928f7e96056b9449932253b75de

Change-Id: I48ca99ea58fbb624b8bccf205e40000115c53060
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_ceilometer refs/changes/97/385697/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add macros to handle -test packages

The 2 new macros can be used to simplifiy the creation of -test
packages for the different clients.
Also bump the openstack-macros version.

Change-Id: Ie983f7a80cc540dc9a60b0321bbb1c7940169cd4
(cherry picked from commit a11145def7048ffb626ee2bd63b8c49506d51841)

added_lines: # # OpenStack macros # # the directory where the test files will be installed %openstack_test_package_dir %{_localstatedir}/lib/%{name}-test # Installing a test package is always done the same way. # the macro takes a single parameter - the component which is the # name that is installed into site-packages # e.g. for python-novaclient the name is novaclient %openstack_test_package_install() \ install -d -m 755 %{buildroot}/%{openstack_test_package_dir} \ # Some packages differ here, try to install as much as possible: \ cp -av \\\ README.md README.rst PKG-INFO .testr.conf .*tests bin \\\ etc examples run_tests.* setup.cfg setup.py \\\ smoketests static test tests tools tox.ini \\\ %{buildroot}/%{openstack_test_package_dir} || : \ rm -rf %{buildroot}/%{openstack_test_package_dir}/%1 \ ln -s %{python_sitelib}/%1 %{buildroot}/%{openstack_test_package_dir}/%1 \ %nil

commit_message:
Fix domain_id in server manifest

After https://review.openstack.org/#/c/379905/ keystone is case
sensitive when checking domain_id in API calls.

This patch sets the user_domain_id and project_domain_id to the
right "default" id instead of "Default".

Change-Id: I8db6a5f33bbbf7b53b93f66e77a0a06009e612cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/47/389047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Defaults to 'default'# Defaults to 'default' $project_domain_id = 'default', $user_domain_id = 'default',

commit_message:
Remove deprecated first_available_file

The first_available_file option on tasks has been deprecated in
Ansible 2, and will be removed in 2.2. Remove its use in the
config_template plugin similarly to its removal from the upstream
template plugin [0].

[0] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/17643

Change-Id: Icd4f70706979a3f59dd93f116d1c5ef96d66edbe

added_lines: if self._task._role: file_path = self._task._role._role_path searchpath.insert(1, C.DEFAULT_ROLES_PATH) searchpath.insert(1, self._task._role._role_path) else: file_path = self._loader.get_basedir() user_source = self._task.args.get('src') if not user_source: return False, dict( failed=True, msg="No user provided [ src ] was provided" source = self._loader.path_dwim_relative( file_path, 'templates', user_source ) searchpath.insert(1, os.path.dirname(source))
deleted_lines: faf = self._task.first_available_file if faf: task_file = task_vars.get('_original_file', None, 'templates') source = self._get_first_available_file(faf, task_file) if not source: return False, dict( failed=True, msg="could not find src in first_available_file list" ) else: # Access to protected method is unavoidable in Ansible if self._task._role: file_path = self._task._role._role_path searchpath.insert(1, C.DEFAULT_ROLES_PATH) searchpath.insert(1, self._task._role._role_path) else: file_path = self._loader.get_basedir() user_source = self._task.args.get('src') if not user_source: return False, dict( failed=True, msg="No user provided [ src ] was provided" ) source = self._loader.path_dwim_relative( file_path, 'templates', user_source searchpath.insert(1, os.path.dirname(source))

commit_message:
Simplify pip options/constraints mechanism

The current constraints generation for the
installation involves multiple tasks and multiple
variables.

Using multiple tasks extends the installation time
unnecessarily and the additional variables are
unnecessary.

This patch aims to simplify the mechanism and
hopes to speed it up a little.

The tests/os_keystone-overrides.yml file is removed
as it is unnecessary given the merge of
https://review.openstack.org/381479

Depends-On: I0e6d43a9f22add78f693e8836f1dd852be74d6c5
Change-Id: Ief9c7f124eb58b986192b2f958c971197d410799

commit_message:
[DOCS] Added release-name as a watermark to Docs.

Added a water mark to the role documentation
to make clear to deployers which release they're
working with.

Modified conf.py that adds watermark to the documentation according
to particular branch. If the current branch is master than
watermark is 'Pre-release' and if the current branch is
stable/<release-name> than watermark is <release-name>.

This is a combined implementation based on the following
patches:
- https://review.openstack.org/372565
- https://review.openstack.org/382637
- https://review.openstack.org/384140

Change-Id: Icc1c4f2c26df08aefcf6cc613232e650162e665e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/63/388163/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import openstackdocsthemehtml_theme = 'openstackdocs'html_theme_path = [openstackdocstheme.get_html_theme_path()] watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD)\ | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release"
deleted_lines: # html_theme = 'alabaster'# html_theme_path = []watermark = os.popen("git branch --contains $(git rev-parse HEAD) | awk -F/ '/stable/ {print $2}'").read().strip(' \n\t').capitalize() if watermark == "": watermark = "Pre-release"

commit_message:
Switch to stdlib validate_legacy

The stdlib module has deprecated all the validate_* functions and
recommends the use of validate_legacy as a replacement. This change
updates the module to use validate_legacy instead of the existing
validate calls.

Change-Id: I36c09e4d9cd28a3849c123739786c96b0b2f0845
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-barbican refs/changes/73/389273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: validate_legacy("Hash", "validate_hash", $policies)

commit_message:
Don't include openstack/common in flake8 exclude list

The directory openstack/common was used to keep codes from
oslo-incubator, we have retired oslo-incubator,so don't use
this directory any more.

Change-Id: I0750b2f3aa25b079ca9ab95d28353dfdce7a3428

commit_message:
Only disable Neutron tests when our Grenade is running

Unconditionally disabling it in code disables neutron for everyone
importing our plugin.

Partial-Bug: #1621791

commit_message:
Do not extend lists in AIO config

Extending lists in openstack_user_config creates broken overrides,
because it will take the base AIO config and then, for example,
add your overrides to the list of cidr_networks, etc. By turning
off list extend we will have a usable path to override
the openstack_user_config file deployed by the AIO bootstrap role.

Change-Id: Ica90896dfb3f85bde869023ca9e2d4898d5f6201
(cherry picked from commit 60ceb9b4e2fed31d56d44a51b62fe8e6e40f11d0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/33/388933/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Passing eth0 to br-vlan

We've decided to give eth0 for openstack completely, so I think
we can give the eth0 raw interface into the br-vlan for vlan nets.

Change-Id: Ic8d431e73750d4134e860370745169471244be24
(cherry picked from commit 3bb904bde1a0930875d6c9cb57ea9c22dc15e25c)

commit_message:
Work around bad libvirt-python wheel

The following package must always build from source:

- libvirt-python:
  A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities
  from the installed version of libvirt-bin, leading to
  nova-compute failing to start.

Note that this is a re-implementation of
https://review.openstack.org/388027

The re-implementation is necessary as there are no
group_vars scoped to the repo servers. If these vars
are added to group_vars/all then the compute nodes
would also install from source every time, whereas
it only needs to be done in the repo server's wheel
build process.

Closes-Bug: #1625859
Change-Id: I3197f06839c9705574810ab616dff51924435da5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/64/389064/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The following package must always build from source. # # libvirt-python: # A pre-built wheel can be missing libvirt capabilities from the installed # version of libvirt-bin, leading to nova-compute failing to start. # repo_build_pip_no_binary: - libvirt-python

subject: Automatically source the rc file for ansible/ansible-playbook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-19 19:26:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/846e166a34a9bdbd92ee243285171858be70a104', 'message': "Automatically source the rc file for ansible/ansible-playbook

For Newton onwards, when both ansible and ansible-playbook
commands are run the /usr/local/bin/openstack-ansible.rc file
needs to be sourced before executing the commands.

It's very often the case that we get reports that commands have
failed because deployers are trying to use 'ansible-playbook'
instead of 'openstack-ansible'.

This patch ensures that both these commands execute using the
openstack-ansible wrapper to ensure that the rc file is sourced
appropriately and that /etc/openstack_deploy/user*.yml are
included as extra vars under the right circumstances.

The wrapper only implements the sourced config and extra vars if
the ansible/ansible-playbook commands are executed from the git

ensure that non-OSA execution is not interfered with.

As learned and applied in https://review.openstack.org/385511 the
